  NEWS ANALYSIS

  No more fear and loathing in British Columbia <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D98ce818d> Canadian flags on a building <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E98ce818d>Bloomberg Creative Photos/Getty Images In an attempt to stem its opioid crisis, British Columbia is testing something that may at first seem counterintuitive: decriminalizing those drugs. The Canadian province started a three-year hard drug decriminalization trial run <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8e740ae5> on Tuesday.

While it will still be unlawful to sell and traffic these drugs, as well as to bring them into airports and schools, possessing small quantities (less than 2.5 grams, or one-tenth of an ounce) for personal use won’t be penalized.

* Adults carrying that amount of opioids like heroin and fentanyl, as well as cocaine, meth, or ecstasy, will no longer run afoul of the law.

* Police will not seize the drugs, and users will be informed about resources for substance abuse recovery.

But as they went into effect this week, the new rules stirred up questions about whether they’ll actually work.

Good intentions, but mixed responses

The law aims to move toward treating drug abuse as a public health issue rather than one that requires handcuffs. BC’s government hopes that the new approach “will help reduce the barriers and stigma that prevent people from accessing life-saving supports and services.”

Many activists welcome the reform, arguing that it’ll relocate drug use to safer spaces and make it easier for users to seek recovery care. Groups like the international HIV advocacy organization UNAIDs have long advocated for decriminalization as a way to reduce the spreading of the disease via needle sharing.

But many drug users and recovery advocates see the BC law as a “half measure”: Various stakeholders (including <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2ebfe0f> the provincial government itself) believe the 2.5-gram threshold is too low to accommodate heavy drug users and those who buy in bulk. Experts also point to a lack of access to safe drugs and a shortage of spaces in treatment programs, with many provincial officials acknowledging that more needs to be done.

So, how has decriminalization fared before?

British Columbia isn’t the only place to try “decrim,” as the approach is known. Portugal, the Netherlands, and the Czech Republic have all adopted some form of it. It’s even being tried in the US: In 2021, Oregon became the first (and so far the only) state to decriminalize all drugs after the policy passed as a ballot measure.

Portugal is the standard-bearer for decrim success: Instituted in 2001 amid a devastating heroin epidemic, the country has seen drug-related deaths plummet. Though fatal overdoses have since risen, drug death rates remain below <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc528034c> the EU average.

Oregon, meanwhile, has posted mixed results, and the measure remains controversial. Despite its expansion of resources for those with substance abuse disorders, the state experienced a faster-than-nationwide-average rise in overdose deaths for the year 2021, and some observers point to low uptake of treatment programs.

Zoom out: Other Canadian provinces and governments abroad have their notepads out, preparing to watch BC’s experiment closely. But even decrim proponents acknowledge that the strategy can’t work on its own and must be paired with shifting resources toward healthcare and fighting addiction.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc14907d9>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C50cbfd8c>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4899b1a1>

Streaming binge: Physical: 100 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2026810f> is “Squid Game meets Gladiator <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C54e57ec4>.”

  DESTINATIONS

  Place to be: 10 miles west of Boston a screenshot of The Last of Us depicting a setting 10 miles west of Boston The Last of Us/HBO It’s a big world out there. In this section, we’ll teleport you to an interesting location—and hopefully give you travel ideas in the process.

In last Sunday’s episode of The Last of Us, the HBO drama got Massholes even more riled up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4a177936> than usual by claiming this mountainous landscape was located 10 miles west of Boston. New Englanders called BS by pointing out: a) that is not what eastern Massachusetts looks like and b) the only thing wild about the place is the logos on quarter-zips.

Plus, the show was primarily filmed in rugged Alberta, Canada, which seems much more likely to be the setting for the shot.

So what actually is 10 miles from Boston? Well, it’s Massachusetts, so a cluster of college campuses, including Boston College, Wellesley, Brandeis, Bentley, and Babson. That area is also home to the very lovely and very Massachusetts-sounding suburbs of Waltham, Watertown, and Newton.

Sound like a nice place to live? Sure is, but it’ll cost you: The median sale price for a home in Newton was $1.2 million in December, according to Redfin.—NF

  COMMUNITY

  Crowd work Last Sunday, we asked readers how the IRS should recruit new talent as it faces a wave of retirements. Our favorite responses:

* “With the promise of their very own Cayman Islands tax haven instead of the usual 401(k) employees get.”—AK from Chicago, IL

* “Ask MrBeast to make a video titled ‘I gave FREE jobs to my most gracious and mathematically gifted followers’ and have them compete for jobs.”—Pranaad K. from Laredo, Texas

* “New employees can go on raids of celebrity homes to collect items to auction for back taxes.”—Wendy from Knoxville, TN

* “Come work for us and get a 10% employee discount on your income tax!”—Doug from British Columbia

This week’s question

With Netflix preparing to crack down on password sharing, we’re going to hold a contest: Who thinks they have the most distant connection to the holder of the Netflix account they use?

If you have an extremely distant connection to the account holder, share it here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C01a61a7f>.

 TOGETHER WITH

Droplette <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc209bbf4> 
Good morning. On this day 19 years ago, Harvard sophomore Mark Zuckerberg launched The Facebook. The site eventually became just “Facebook” after Sean Parker reportedly told Zuck to drop the “The.” Which got us thinking: What other names could be improved by dropping the “The”? A few ideas…

Markets: Stocks ended the week subdued <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cab5853a7> yesterday when a red-hot jobs report once again got investors biting their nails over what the Fed will do next—though the S&P and Nasdaq both eked out positive weeks. The tech stock rally started losing steam after several big companies reported disappointing quarterly results, with Amazon being the one investors cooled on most.

 

ECONOMY

Hiring refuses to slow down <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dfebb5e24> Now hiring sign <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Efebb5e24> Francis Scialabba
The seemingly endless announcements of mass layoffs notwithstanding, Americans haven’t been this employed in more than fifty years. The Bureau of Labor Statistics said <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUy0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9217f1e5> yesterday that the US added a whopping 517,000 jobs last month and the unemployment rate dropped slightly, to 3.4%—the lowest it’s been since 1969.

The jump in new hires was almost triple what experts predicted and amounts to the biggest monthly gain since July. So, where has “you’re hired!” been exclaimed the most?

The most jobs created were in leisure and hospitality (128,000), professional and business services (82,000), and government (74,000), with the last figure partially due to formerly striking state university employees returning to work.

The news of the January jobs jump comes on the heels of a Department of Labor report that said over 11 million jobs were open at the end of last year. So, while tech giants like Alphabet, Meta, and Amazon have all laid people off, many workers may be getting both severance packages and job offers. The IT industry was still looking to fill 109,000 job openings as of December, and IT folks were wanted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc3978768> at companies like PwC and Northrop Grumman.

Why no one saw this coming

On Wednesday, the Federal Reserve raised interest rates for the eighth time since last March as part of its ongoing efforts to combat historic inflation. As any freshman economics textbook will tell you, the Fed’s moves are liable to drive up unemployment and threaten to tip the economy into a recession.

But this round of jobs data suggests that we must be living in a parallel reality, where the laws of economics don’t apply: Job growth just keeps on trucking, while inflation has been slowing.

Looking forward: The rapid job creation dampens hopes that the Fed will stop raising interest rates in the next few months. But a labor market seemingly signaling “can’t nobody hold me down” eases fears of an impending recession.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf53dc827>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B92903c7d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce7bac0d6>   

TOGETHER WITH DROPLETTE

Fall in love with your skincare routine <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C369c813f> Droplette <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C388400be>
You wouldn’t waste time or money on a bad relationship, so why do that with your skincare? 90% of traditional products never actually absorb into the skin—they’re wiped or sweated off before making a difference.

Droplette’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C195fd3ac> breakthrough technology supports your skin by transforming serums into tiny, high-velocity micro-drops that get 20x deeper, where they are most effective.

The result feels like a gentle mist but delivers an injectable alternative without needles or pain. This means ingredients like collagen, often notoriously too large for absorption, can absorb into the skin successfully, leaving it hydrated and plump.

It’s time to break up with disappointing skincare and get into a healthy relationship with Droplette. Brew readers save 50% on Droplette devices with code BREWLOVE <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cff5da99e>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines The news showing frigid temperatures forecast for New England ABC news screenshot
🧊 New England’s being hit with an epic cold snap. (Thanks, Punxsutawney Phil.) This morning, wind chills could plummet to -10°F in New York City, -33°F in Boston, and as low as -60°F in Maine. Warnings about the extreme weather <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B16e5b72b> are in effect throughout New England. Some areas could experience their coldest weather in decades, and New Hampshire may hit an all-time low temp with wind chills dropping to -100°F. Thankfully, the chill’s expected to thaw by Monday.

Elon Musk off the hook for an apparent 420 joke. A jury found the Tesla CEO not liable <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0ed76558> for investors’ losses after his 2018 tweet that he had “funding secured” to take the electric car company private for $420 per share. Investors had been seeking billions of dollars in damages to cover their losses due to a sell-off that took place in the days after the tweet. Musk has long contended that there was nothing wrong with the tweet, even though he settled when the SEC sued him over it.

Battle of the beans: Anyone walking by the corner of Leonard and Church Streets in NYC might be wondering how they ended up in Chicago. A sculpture reminiscent of “the bean” in Chicago’s Millennium Park has just been completed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7f81d44c> in TriBeCa, and the resemblance is not a coincidence: The reflective sculpture was created by the same British artist, Anish Kapoor, as the one in Chicago. NYC media is criticizing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C589bf57c> the new bean for diminishing New York’s original flair, but the real loser here is Boston, the actual Beantown, which is still without a bean.

ESPIONAGE

This is not a party balloon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ddda6e494> The suspected Chinese spy balloon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Edda6e494> Chase Doak
Not since Balloon Boy has a balloon flying over the Rocky Mountain region caused such a kerfuffle: Yesterday, the US canceled <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cec98377f> the secretary of state’s planned visit to China after a suspected Chinese spy balloon was spotted over military sites in Montana before drifting eastward.

China claimed the object, which is still floating over the US, is merely a “civilian airship” conducting weather research that got blown off course, and expressed “regrets” for the incident. The Pentagon, however, is giving that as much credence as it would a liposuctioned celebrity paid to hawk weight loss teas.

Why bother with a balloon when China has satellites and TikTok to spy with? The older technology is cheaper to deploy and can be fitted with modern tech like cameras and radar sensors.  Plus, they can linger over a spot longer than satellites can. But experts say the most likely reason China went with a balloon was to make a statement <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf9a76a75> that it’s ready to take the US on. It likely even wanted to get caught snooping.

Zoom out: This probably isn’t going to help warm up the frosty relations between the US and China. The two countries have  been going at each other lately over issues like chip technology and the status of Taiwan.—AR

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C85acdc96>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1356fc57>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc93e6d31>    

TOGETHER WITH PRIMAL KITCHEN

Primal Kitchen <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdFI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7c71c835>
Extra sauce, plz. How can a turkey + bacon + avocado sandwich go from “pretty good” to “you have to try this”? The secret’s in the sauce: Primal Kitchen Buffalo Mayo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdFM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0639cec9>. It’s creamy. It’s a li’l spicy. And it’s a great dip for veggies or fries, too. Get saucy and find it in stores or take 25% off your online order <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdFM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf2397e10>.



FOOD

Sushi terrorists post their germy deeds on social media <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dfc027c05> Bitten sushi on a conveyor belt <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Efc027c05> Francis Scialabba
Young adults in Japan are committing crimes against sushi <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C98f07284>—and we don’t mean ordering California rolls. Social media posts of people touching, licking, and otherwise messing with food as it travels by at conveyor belt restaurants have gone viral and caused some to question Japan’s communal values.

What’s going on?

At the end of January, the term “sushi tero” (which means sushi terrorism) was used to caption a video of someone licking the inside of cups and soy sauce bottle caps at the “sushi train” chain, Sushiro. The clip has over 40 million views on Twitter, made the rounds on Japanese broadcast news, and caused the stock of the restaurant’s parent company to drop <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32795746> 5% on Tuesday.

Before that clip ignited the trend by naming it, videos of other fishy acts—like slathering passing sushi with wasabi—had gone viral throughout the month. These incidents, explains the Japan Times <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d4bb421>, stem from a wider, yearslong trend.

Zoom out: Conveyor belt restaurants are a 740 billion yen, or $5.7 billion, industry in Japan, per Teikoku Databank. Restaurant chains affected by sushi terrorism are taking legal action, as well as replacing circuitous belts with straight-to-the-customer ones or powering them down entirely. Some worry “trust-based businesses” like these simply don’t work in modern Japan.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6ce30517>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C255b8e6d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d3e662e>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Milk being poured into a Starbucks coffee drink Giphy
Stat: If you’ve been relying on the Starbucks on the corner to get your heart pumping every morning, you’re paying five dollars to be served weak tea, er, coffee. A Starbucks cappuccino has five times less caffeine <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C14ee1f94> than one from Costa Coffee (66 milligrams vs. 325 milligrams), and the chain’s single espresso shot has about six times less than one from lunchtime staple Pret A Manger (Pret’s has 180 milligrams to the mermaid cup’s 33 milligrams), according to UK consumer group Which.

Quote: “My watch thinks I’m dead.”

You may want to leave your Apple Watch at home if you’re planning a big trip to Gstaad. The devices have been mistakenly calling 911 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5a0b3dea> because their crash-detection feature keeps confusing trips down ski slopes for car wrecks. Could be Apple just doesn’t like fun, since the same feature previously made headlines for being triggered by roller coasters.

Read: Are Wall Street’s short kings heroes or villains? (The Atlantic <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C738ee4ce>)

Open House

Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that’s wondering how many pool parties you’re really going to throw this summer. We’ll give you two different properties and you have to determine which one is more expensive.

Queens, NY home with pool next to Green Bay, WI mansion with much bigger pool.ZillowListing No. 1 (left): This four bed, 3.5 bath <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVHk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9c027517> contemporary colonial in Queens, NY, (Flushing, to be precise) has a massive living room that could double as a fancy dance studio if you’re cool with no furniture. In addition to 2,625 square feet of running-around space, the home features a saltwater pool and a hot tub.

Listing No. 2 (right): The in-ground pool on the second listing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVHo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc4bf552d> could probably double as an outdoor ice rink, because this home is located in Green Bay, WI. Though its swimming season might be shorter, this 8,042 square-foot mansion is much more spacious than the Queens house, and its expansive outdoor area features a fireplace, a gazebo, and a pool house with a kitchenette.

So, which house is more expensive?

ANSWER

The Queens home was sold for $1.48 million last June. The Green Bay home is listed for $2 million.

Morning Brew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9yWj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNDQxNTQ4LjM0NTQ2MzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E35d1c4ac>

 TOGETHER WITH

LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbb005f22> 
Good morning. In the words of Jack Black, “Math is a really cool thing.”

Here’s one reason why: The number of minutes in February (in non-leap years) is equivalent to 8 factorial. As Tim Urban calculated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2f3b0632>…

February has 28 days (7 x 4)

Each day has 24 hours (8 x 3)

Each hour has 60 minutes (6 x 5 x 2)

So, the number of minutes in February is 8 x 7 x 6 x 5 x 4 x 3 x 2 x 1, aka 8! Neat!

—Neal Freyman, Max Knoblauch, Jamie Wilde, Abby Rubenstein

Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNDQxNTQ4LjM0NTQ2MzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C85b23e50>

Markets: If you hung on to your tech stocks during the rout of 2022, you’ve got to be feeling good right now. After another smashing day, the tech-focused Nasdaq is off to its best start to a year since 1975. Meta played an outsized role—the company’s stock posted its biggest single-day gain in almost 10 years after Mark Zuckerberg dubbed 2023 the “year of efficiency.”

On tap today: the January jobs report. It’ll provide crucial insight into a labor market that’s giving more mixed signals than TJ’s Philly Cheesesteak Bao Buns. On the one hand, jobless claims dropped to a nine-month low last week. On the other, US employers announced more than 100,000 job cuts in January, which amounts to the most monthly layoffs since 2020, according to Challenger, Gray & Christmas.

 

BUSINESS

How to lose $108b in 1 week <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da9a14e1a> Gautam Adani <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea9a14e1a> Mint/Getty Images
Just one month ago, we thought it would be impossible for someone to lose more money more quickly than FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried did.

Enter Gautam Adani. In the week since the Indian mogul was targeted by a short seller, his businesses have lost a combined $108 billion in value, and his own net worth has plummeted by $52 billion. Because Adani was once the second-richest person in the world, he’s still got plenty left in the bank. But, as Bloomberg notes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7cc408d1>, his downfall “defies just about every historical comparison.”

Given Adani’s sprawling business empire and his cozy relationship with India’s leadership class, this crisis has echoed across both markets and politics. Here’s a rundown of what you need to know about the most important story in global business this week.

Who is Adani and how did he get so rich? Adani, who grew up middle-class, dropped out of college to trade diamonds and eventually formed his own business hawking other physical products. During the ’90s his ambitions expanded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb13794f8> along with the Indian economy, and he now runs a conglomerate that encompasses energy, transportation infrastructure such as ports and airports, defense manufacturing, and media.

What sparked the collapse? On Jan. 24, a US short seller named Hindenburg Research claimed Adani’s empire pulled “the largest con in corporate history,” accusing it of stock manipulation and accounting fraud in a 100-page report. Adani has denied the allegations, but his pushback hasn’t comforted spooked investors…especially after he scrapped a $2.5 billion share sale on Wednesday. 

How has this infiltrated politics? Adani responded that Hindenburg’s report wasn’t just an attack on him, it amounted to a “calculated attack on India…and the growth story and ambition of India.” Adani’s business ventures have aligned closely with the priorities of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, and Modi’s political opponents are seizing on the fiasco to highlight the relationship between India’s leader and Adani.

What happens next? Adani emphasized that his company’s fundamentals remain “very strong” and its balance sheet “healthy.” Still, experts say the accusations could leave a lasting reputational stain on India’s largest corporations and hamstring their ability to grow.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6cbd73a5>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C851e6a2b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc20e8392>   

TOGETHER WITH LIQUIDPISTON

Take your portfolio full throttle <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7480b36d> LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5e19b7ed>
Meet the X-Engine™ from LiquidPiston: a patented, redesigned rotary engine that’s up to 10x lighter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0fe90003> than comparable piston engines of the same power.

And guess what? LiquidPiston’s giving you the chance to become a shareholder in the future success of their engine technology.

LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3aff8e87> is kicking new markets into top gear, from drones that can fly 2x farther to hybrid-electric cars that can use 80% smaller batteries.

Best of all, the engine is compatible with a variety of fuels, including hydrogen. This could unlock a 100% green energy solution for the combustion engine market.

No wonder they’ve secured $30m in contracts from the US Army, the Air Force, and more.

WORLD

Tour de headlines LeBron James looking up ESPN via Giphy
It’s a bird, it’s a plane, it’s a…Chinese spy balloon? US officials presumably scanning the sky for the green comet saw something else entirely: a surveillance balloon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xT3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4af25d3f> they’re confident was sent by China. Pentagon authorities said they’ve been tracking the balloon, which was spotted floating high above Montana, but decided not to blow it up out of safety concerns. The discovery of ramped-up Chinese spy operations comes days ahead of an expected meeting between Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing.

Big Tech earnings were a wet blanket. Despite the euphoria over tech stocks on Wall Street, disappointing Big Tech earnings <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xT3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb1179c2f> showed that companies are still facing tough economic conditions. Apple posted a rare quarterly sales decline, Alphabet is “meaningfully” slowing down its hiring, and Amazon’s cash cow—AWS—isn’t growing like it had been. We’ll see if these underwhelming reports put the brakes on the Nasdaq’s rally today.

Artificial tears could be causing real infections. The CDC urged the public to stop using EzriCare Artificial Tears, saying the over-the-counter lubricating eye drops may be linked to an outbreak of drug-resistant infections <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xT3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C65c0c275> that have caused vision loss in at least five people and at least one death. EzriCare said it stopped selling and distributing the drops, which are manufactured in India by a different company, when it learned of the CDC’s investigation. But the company stated it was not aware of testing that “definitively” linked the infections to the product.

SOCIAL MEDIA

New MrBeast video sparks healthcare debate <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D7df046b0> MrBeast <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E7df046b0> Dave Kotinsky/Getty Images
YouTuber MrBeast (real name Jimmy Donaldson) has moved on from recreating Squid Game to going creative mode on the US healthcare system. The 24-year-old and world’s most popular YouTuber uploaded a video <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRmw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C88c56be4> over the weekend that revealed he funded cataract surgery for 1,000 people.

The video, titled “1,000 Blind People See For The First Time,” has garnered more than 77 million views on Donaldson’s channel, but sparked debates around the use of philanthropy as a revenue driver and prompted some viewers to express frustration with medical expenses in the country.

The surgery costs about $3,500 per eye, according to MyVision.org, and the participants in MrBeast’s video weren’t able to afford medical insurance.

Criticism of the video focused primarily on the broader implications of an altruistic YouTuber funding surgeries as content, but some are more generally unsettled by the idea that the MrBeast channel—which has featured videos of people being paid to live in a windowless room and stay in a circle in the middle of nowhere for 100 days—is earning revenue off of charitable acts.

To his critics, MrBeast responded:

MrBeast@MrBeast via TwitterZoom out: Donaldson’s main channel has 131 million subscribers and generated about $54 million in revenue in 2021. He gave away more than $3 million in prizes in 2022.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C90e647ee>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf6f1115e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfbd72b94>

ENVIRONMENT

Why JPMorgan just bought a forest <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd5ce1a94> JPMorgan's logo on top of a forest <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed5ce1a94> Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: zlikovec/Getty Images
On Wednesday, JPMorgan’s wealth management arm said it acquired <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8cc33434> 250,000 acres of woodlands in the Southeastern US for $500 million. And it’s not so Jamie Dimon can cosplay Snow White: Buying timberland has become trendy for long-term investors because trees are not only worth something when cut down, but also when left standing.

Why? In this era of corporate sustainability pledges, companies are hungrily buying up carbon offsets—tradable certificates that represent the reduction of CO2 in the atmosphere—to counteract their own carbon output. One of the most popular types of carbon offsets pays lumberjacks to lay down their chainsaws and preserve naturally CO2-absorbing forests for a period of time.

That’s changed the game for timberland owners (and we don’t mean Drake). “Rather than waiting to get paid, they can now get paid to wait,” the global head of alternative investments for JPMorgan, which plans to use its new forest for both wood production and carbon offsets, wrote <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7f09bc2f> in a September blog post.

Zoom out: Investors are betting big—really big—on the market for carbon offsets. This past fall, a consortium led by a T. Rowe Price subsidiary paid $1.8 billion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C828fdd98> for 1.7 million acres of forest across 17 states. Only 10%–20% of the revenue from these properties is expected to come from logging.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca04e5dc3>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C084359f0>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C52cfaefe>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators ChatGPT on top of a podium next to Instagram and TikTok logos Francis Scialabba
Stat: ChatGPT is now officially the fastest-growing consumer application <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C723f27e5> in history after it notched 100 million monthly active users in January, per estimates from UBS. It took OpenAI’s chatbot just two months from launch to reach the milestone, compared to nine months for TikTok and 2.5 years for Instagram. So, how to capitalize on this explosion of interest? Open AI said it will soon release ChatGPT Plus, a commercial version, for $20/month.

Quote: “The federal government has no business telling American families how to cook their dinner.”

Politicians are lining up to protect your gas stove. Democratic Sen. Joe Manchin joined with GOP colleague Sen. Ted Cruz to introduce legislation that would block <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xT3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf33a8718> the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) from using federal funds to ban gas stoves. Meanwhile, in Florida, Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis floated a permanent tax exemption for gas stoves. Some lawmakers consider the appliances to be under attack after a top official at the CPSC hinted that new gas stoves could be banned over health concerns.

Republicans <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C21d74269> removed Democrat Rep. It earned nearly $40 billion in 2022, making last year its most profitable in its 115-year history.

Michael Bennet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTks_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9f23d194> urged Apple and Google to remove TikTok from their app stores over the national security threat posed by the Chinese-owned app.

FROM THE CREW

The Tax Guide is here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTk0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E29e3284d> Tax Guide promo image <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTk0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2F29e3284d>
It’s the start of a new year, which means resolutions, fresh beginnings, and of course...tax season.

We know filing your taxes can be a massive headache that takes hours (if not days) to complete. That’s why Money Scoop created a 2023 Tax Guide to make filing taxes a bit easier. We break down tough topics, provide expert insights, and answer a bunch of hypothetical questions to help you out.

Check out the guide <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTk0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2G29e3284d>.

Friday puzzle

Clear off your work schedule this morning, because today’s puzzle, from Ministry of Quizzes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C28c51707>, will require your full attention.

What completes the following sequence?

Important info: The same consonants are represented by numbers 0–9, and all vowels are represented by *.

7**3*6

*41*2*

03**

25**4

9*33*8

*5*42*

?

ANSWER

5*1, which indicates “red.” These are the colors of the rainbow in reverse order (violet, indigo, blue, green, yellow, orange, red).

 TOGETHER WITH

Cariuma <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMwJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5f73dea5> 
Good morning and Happy Groundhog Day. While Punxsutawney Phil is a vibes-only critter—you don’t have to be.

The Brew’s Data Storytelling course teaches you how to make dashboards that transform all the data you’ve collected into something your team can actually use to make decisions. It starts Feb. 13 and lasts just one week (plus, it’s virtual).

Don’t be like Phil. Use data to help you reach conclusions. Learn more about the course here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb247f4a7>.

—Neal Freyman, Max Knoblauch, Jamie Wilde, Abby Rubenstein

Markets: Stocks started the day off sluggish but jumped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C477802ae> up later when investors decided to brush off the Fed’s decision to hike rates again yesterday (more on that in a sec). They had no love for Tinder owner Match Group, though. The company’s stock fell after it announced disappointing financial results and layoffs.

 

ECONOMY

Powell warns against premature celebrations <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D207dfab5> A shoulders-up photo of Fed Chair Jerome Powell looking off into the distance <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E207dfab5> Sarah Silbiger/Getty Images
Yesterday, Fed Chair Jerome Powell did his best impression of a football coach whose team holds a third-quarter lead: Our game plan to tame inflation is working so far, he suggested, but don’t douse me in Gatorade just yet.

Following the Fed’s first meeting of the year, the central bank hiked interest rates <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C55620ab2> by the expected 25 basis points. It’s the smallest rate hike since last March, and a sign that the Fed’s bitter struggle to rein in prices is having an impact.

Annual inflation fell to 6.5% in December from a peak of 9.1% in June.

There’s even a good chance your Super Bowl party will cost less <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0698ee78> than last year’s. Prices for chicken wings, avocados, and steak have all fallen since last January (along with those of many other goods).

In a closely watched press conference, Powell emphasized “it is a good thing” that prices are coming down in many sectors.

But he isn’t ready to hang up the “Mission Accomplished” banner

Powell made it clear that Americans should expect “a couple more rate hikes” going forward. The concern? Inflation is a nasty beast—there’s no guarantee it’s going to keep on falling like it has been.

And some economists have pointed to signs that activity is picking back up again <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C43f3aba7> right when we need it to continue slowing down. Housing demand is coming off of its lows, gas prices have climbed since December, and the labor market is still running too hot for the Fed’s liking.

Making things even dicier for Powell is the recent stock market rally. So far in 2023, investors have been gobbling up stocks as if the inflation problem has already been solved. But, in an ironic twist, their optimism that inflation is toast…could actually push inflation higher by boosting asset prices.

If there’s one lesson to be learned from all of this, it’s never go into macroeconomics if you value getting things right the first time.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd39d3521>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B69af5dda>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc56aff78>   

TOGETHER WITH CARIUMA

The viral sneaker that always sells out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMwJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C64c23e5a> Cariuma <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMwJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5a47c91a>
No matter the temp outside, embracing easy-breezy beach vibes is always in season, especially when it comes to comfy footwear.

Loved by celebs, surfers, and skaters, Cariuma’s sustainable sneakers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMwJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb46fbf51> are undeniably cool, with over 33k 5-star reviews to prove it. Now they’re back after clearing a 77k waitlist, and peeps. are. stoked.

Made with organic cotton and recycled materials, the OCA Low Canvas are a goes-with-everything must-have. From warm neutrals to bold leopard prints, there’s a style to match any outfit, including the classic white leather Salvas. It’s no surprise they’ve been touted by Vogue, Rolling Stone, and GQ as kicks you can’t pass up.

Grab Cariuma’s consciously sourced crowd-pleasers ASAP. For a limited time, use code MBFEB20 for 20% off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMwJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C27f06043>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Justin Sullivan/Getty Images
Meta stock soars on 2023 status update. Facebook’s parent company reported declining sales for the third straight quarter and said its Reality Labs unit lost $13.7 billion in 2022, but its stock still popped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C86d8a69b> ~20% in extended trading. Why? Revenue beat expectations, the company announced a $40 billion share buyback, and Zuck painted a rosy picture for the rest of 2023 (dubbing it “The Year of Efficiency”). Outside of its earnings, Meta reportedly notched a win against the FTC when a judge <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb68dad5> refused to block its acquisition of VR startup Within Unlimited.

Hundreds gathered to mourn Tyre Nichols. The family of Tyre Nichols, a 29-year-old Black man who died after being beaten by Memphis police officers, held a funeral <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS1A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C741381d1> yesterday where he was remembered as a loving father who enjoyed skateboarding and photography. Several speakers also called for legal reforms to address police violence, including Rev. Al Sharpton, who delivered the eulogy, and Vice President Kamala Harris. “This violent act was not in pursuit of public safety,” the vice president said. 

Biden and McCarthy agree to keep talking. President Biden and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy don’t agree on much—especially when it comes to raising the debt ceiling. But the two did at least agree to continue discussing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf95a7898> the issue after their initial meeting yesterday failed to produce a breakthrough in a surprise to no one who’s been paying even a little attention. McCarthy said after the meeting that he believed the two would ultimately “find common ground.” Let’s hope so, since the alternative is the US being unable to pay its bills come June.

SPORTS

Tom Brady retired again, starts new job soon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D0f3c0d83> Tom Brady <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E0f3c0d83> @TomBrady via Twitter
Tom Brady celebrated the one-year anniversary of his retirement announcement with...another retirement announcement. The seven-time Super Bowl winner and (until yesterday) the NFL’s oldest active player announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce83c9995> the decision on social media, capping a legendary 23-year career.

Brady’s days tossin’ the ol’ pigskin around might be over, but the 45-year-old is retiring at the top of several major all-time record lists. He’s No. 1 in passing completions (7,753), touchdowns (649) and yards (89,214).

And, despite taking a reportedly ungodly loss from his financial stake in FTX, Brady has set up a comfortable nest egg in case you were worried. Last year, #12 signed a 10-year, $375 million deal with Fox to become the network’s primary analyst beginning whenever he decided to retire.

That’s more than Brady made playing in the NFL and the biggest contract in sports television, by the way.

Zoom out: In recent years, networks have written massive checks to lock in star broadcast talent—inking deals worth more than $1 billion for pro talkers like Brady, Troy Aikman, Joe Buck, and Tony Romo.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C57887d67>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B8a8983be>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3e858bf9>  

ENTERTAINMENT

Netflix wants users to pay for their own accounts (the audacity!) <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS28_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2De40fc295> A Netflix logo in chains <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS28_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ee40fc295> Francis Scialabba
Netflix doesn’t care if you’re “just a baby;” it’s kicking you off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C383b9d06> your parents’ account if you don’t actually live with them. Netflix support pages, spotted yesterday by The Streamable before they got taken down, laid out a plan to cut back on password sharing by chaining accounts to a single location.

The streaming giant hasn’t confirmed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cba8bc19b> the new terms, but it has made it clear it wants to end password sharing. The plan would require users to pick a “primary location” through their TV (or pick for them if they don’t). If devices with that selected location don’t access Netflix using the location’s wi-fi at least once every 31 days, the account owner will have to pay an “extra member” fee or the user will be barred from binging Wednesday on that device.

This ruthless update wouldn’t be the first time Netflix has cracked down on password sharing after it lost subscribers for two consecutive quarters last year for the first time ever. Netflix has already…

Rolled out new features that allow users to kick profiles off their own accounts and let booted users transfer their watch history to a new account.

Started charging fees for extra users in select countries in Latin America, where password sharing runs particularly rampant.

The strategy’s working: Starting to root out password sharing—along with the launch of a cheaper, ad-supported tier <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3a3ba804> in some countries—has already helped Netflix recoup subscribers. It added 7.7 million subs in the last quarter of 2022, three million more than it had expected.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd19c6aec>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf4ffd29a>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8d9a6003>   

TOGETHER WITH DIVERSYFUND

DiversyFund <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMwJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc496f524>
Meet the (multi)family: With the markets feelin’ hot and cold, investors should ensure they’re gettin’ serious with the right assets for long-term potential, like real estate. But not just any ol’ real estate: Multifamily is a proven way to hedge against inflation + stock market volatility, which is why DiversyFund <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMwJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce5416028>’s made it a cornerstone of their new Premier Offerings for accredited investors. Learn more <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xSzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMwJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7f9a475d>.*



GRAB BAG

Key Performance Indicators Bill Murray in Groundhog Day Groundhog Day/Columbia Pictures via Giphy
Stat: It’s Groundhog Day, the only day where—in the words of Phil Connors—people are happy to stand around “freezing their butts off waiting to worship a rat.” But Punxsutawney Phil might not deserve our worship: The rodent has only correctly predicted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb0be713b> the weather about 39% of the time since humans began looking for his shadow in 1887, per the Stormfax Almanac. The National Weather Service has said a good accuracy rate would be more like 60%.

Quote: “We were on the brink of extinction, and that’s no longer the case.”

Peloton crashed harder than we do after riding up a hill with Alex once the pandemic stopped trapping everyone at home, but CEO Barry McCarthy hinted that it’s now ready to make an “epic comeback.” <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5dde565a> Peloton reported its quarterly results yesterday, and even though it failed to turn a profit and equipment sales slumped, revenue from subscriptions grew—and that’s the area McCarthy plans to focus on.

Read: What the streaming boom has done to documentaries. (Vulture <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf6a7be5c>)

What else is brewing
The FBI <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2622f14c> searched President Biden’s Delaware beach house yesterday and found no classified documents there.

Intel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3f5f34c4> higher-ups from CEO Pat Gelsinger down to mid-level managers will take a pay cut after the company reported historically bad financial results. In more bad news for managers, FedEx <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C24c51b2b> said it will lay off more than 10% of its management staff as it looks to cut costs.

The College Board <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C41c02488> made changes to its AP African American Studies curriculum after Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis said he would ban the class in the state.

A half million workers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdc057aed> walked off the job yesterday in the UK seeking higher wages amid a cost of living crisis. Organizers say it’s the country’s biggest strike in over a decade.

Beyoncé <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0fa81a4a> announced the dates for her Renaissance World Tour. Ticketmaster better not screw this one up.

Three headlines and a lie

Three of these headlines are real and one is faker than saying “We should totally hang out sometime!” when you run into your old coworker on the sidewalk. Can you spot the odd one out?

 TOGETHER WITH

Facet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQwJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C186d272e> 
Good morning. It’s a new month, which means that a fresh slate of shows and movies are hitting streaming services.

One we might skip: Pixar is releasing a short that shows Carl Fredricksen from Up going on his first date since his wife Ellie died. For everyone who’s only now beginning to recover from that tear-jerker of a montage at the beginning of the movie…it’s still too soon to be sending Carl back on the market.

What’s next? Nemo goes to college and we have to watch Marlin process his feelings about being an empty nester? We can only take so much…

—Max Knoblauch, Sam Klebanov, Neal Freyman
