Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNDE2OTM1LjMwMjU0NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C93892141>

Markets: After getting pummeled last year, stocks closed out the first month of 2023 much like your friends who did Dry January—without a hangover. All three indexes rose last month, but the tech-focused Nasdaq shined brightest <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfb0d81f8> with a more than 11% gain. Yesterday’s game ball went to Spotify, which revealed strong user growth last quarter.

On tap today: meetings that could not have been emails. The Fed is expected to announce an interest rate hike of 25 basis points, which would represent a downshift from a series of larger hikes in 2022. Across town, President Biden will meet with House Speaker Kevin McCarthy to hopefully make progress on the looming debt ceiling crisis.

 

BIOTECH

The company trying to phoenix the dodo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D99ce2933> Dodo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E99ce2933> Education Images/Getty Images
The same biotech startup that plans to “resurrect” the woolly mammoth announced a fresh round of funding that’s aimed at de-extincting <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1248fbbe> the famously extinct dodo. Which means if they next try to revive that freaky little squirrel who loves acorns, we can really get cooking on this live-action Ice Age reboot.

Colossal Biosciences, the biotech company in question, said Tuesday that it raised $150 million at a $1.5 billion valuation, bringing its total funding since 2021 to $225 million, per Bloomberg.

About the dodo: For a company in the de-extinction space, the dodo is something of a white whale. Hunting and habitat takeover led to its demise in the late 1600s, and it’s the poster bird for human-caused extinction. A preserved specimen in a Danish museum provided enough dodo DNA for Colossal to get the project off the ground (something the dodo could not do, notably).

A long and controversial road ahead

The dodo is the third species Colossal has said it will attempt to revive after pledging to bring back the woolly mammoth <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRlE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C919a23d1> and the thylacine (Tasmanian tiger). As you might imagine, the process isn’t straightforward, and will involve editing the genomes of closely related (living) species and selectively breeding them to create “functional” dodos, mammoths, and thylacines.

Not everyone thinks this is a smart idea. Critics say that de-extinction is an ethical minefield, as it directs resources away from conserving and protecting species that are currently at risk of extinction.

Obviously, none of this will happen overnight, and each step in the process will take years. The company claims it will produce woolly mammoth calves by 2028.

Zoom out: Are Colossal’s investors (which include Paris Hilton, Tony Robbins, and CIA-sponsored VC firm In-Q-Tel) just obsessed with old birds? Not exactly—they’re bullish on all the breakthroughs that could occur along the way to seeing the dodo spread those beautiful wings and unsuccessfully try to fly once more. Colossal has already spun off a software business, and has suggested artificial wombs and gene editing could be future areas for other spinoffs.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc3a6051e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C24ee4103>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb48e25c6>   

TOGETHER WITH FACET

Test your wallet’s wellness <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQwJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbc932a18> Facet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQwJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C61f4b6a2>
Could your financial habits use improvement? Join the club. Luckily, the experts at Facet can help enrich your money mindset.

Take Facet’s free Financial Wellness quiz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRU8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQwJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce9b74f06> to start. It’ll calculate your financial health, needs, and saving habits to give you a free wellness score.

With this score in mind, you can also schedule a free consultation (yep, free again) with a Facet expert who can start you on your journey of saving, spending, and investing with confidence.

And because life is ever changing, a Facet membership can give you ongoing access to dependable financial advice and services at the drop of a dime. It’s like a gym membership for your wallet.

Take the free quiz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRU8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQwJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce43a0cb8> and book your consult <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQwJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C540c4918> today.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Rep. George Santos Alex Wong/Getty Images
Rep. George Santos steps down from committees. Santos, a New York Republican, said he’s recusing himself <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C494d5683> from his two committee assignments (Small Business and Science) because the “media fanfare” around him would distract from Congress’s work. That fanfare stems from revelations that Santos fabricated much of his background, including false claims that he worked at Goldman Sachs and Citigroup. A poll released yesterday showed that nearly 80% of voters in Santos’s district want him to resign.

Winter weather freezes traffic across the South: Hope you didn’t have to fly out of Dallas yesterday, because a major winter storm disrupted travel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0aa1f72c> across Texas and other areas of the South. Airlines canceled more than 1,900 flights as of last evening, and cars got into numerous accidents in the freezing snow/sleet/snowy conditions. Bad news is this ice storm is expected to last until tomorrow morning, affecting a stretch from Texas up to Tennesee.

Drinks on Exxon: In 2022, ExxonMobil posted the most profitable year <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRS0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C684c9bcf> of any Western oil company ever. Thanks to booming energy prices, Exxon made $56 billion in profit last year—equivalent to $6.3 million each hour, per Reuters. The mind-boggling earnings of Western oil giants, which are projected to have been ~$200 billion collectively last year, have also made them a political target for the Biden adminstration, which has blamed them for high gas prices.

AVIATION

Delta turns its planes into floating coffee shops <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRV8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dabd37b04> A plane with wi-fi bars coming out of it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRV8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eabd37b04> Dianna “Mick” McDougall
Realizing you got stuck in a middle seat just got a bit more tolerable, because Delta is switching on free wi-fi <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2ea7cb09> for about 80% of its domestic fleet starting today.

The details: To access free wi-fi on Delta flights, you’ll need to sign in to your Delta SkyMiles frequent flyer account (but that’s also free). Once you do, a time-sucking Netflix binge awaits: Delta says its Viasat-powered internet will give you “video-streaming capable wi-fi speeds…from takeoff to touchdown.”

Why is Delta doing this? Airlines are locked in a fierce competition to capitalize on the travel boom coming out of the pandemic. In-flight wi-fi that’s free and reliable could help them win over customers—especially the bigwigs who fly business class and need to send one-word emails. This isn’t a small investment for Delta: CEO Ed Bastian said the company has spent more than $1 billion on free wi-fi.

Zoom out: Delta’s move will put pressure on other airlines to go full Starbucks. Currently, JetBlue is the only other large US airline that offers free wi-fi, but American is in trial mode and Hawaii Airlines could launch free wi-fi later this year through SpaceX’s Starlink service.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6343627e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cea8d3114>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5f312909>  

CRIME

Monkey business is going down at the Dallas Zoo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd73458a1> emperor tamarin monkey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed73458a1> Steve Clancy Photography/Getty Images
Paging Benoit Blanc: Your detective services are required at the Dallas Zoo, where a string of fishy occurrences has perplexed authorities in recent weeks. The latest mystery? Missing monkeys.

Zoo officials said that two emperor tamarin monkeys had gone missing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceaaa351d> from their enclosures since Monday. The monkeys were found last night in a nearby abandoned house, but they probably didn’t go looking for a starter home by themselves—their habitat was “intentionally compromised,” officials said. In other words, someone broke them out.

The tamarin monkeys incident follows other head-scratchers at the Dallas Zoo:

A clouded leopard that went missing last month was later found outside her cage. Zoo workers discovered an intentional cut in her enclosure and similar tampering in the habitat of the zoo’s langur monkeys.

One of the Dallas Zoo’s endangered vultures was found dead last week with “an unusual wound and injuries,” per CNN.

Zoom out: If the Dallas Zoo is indeed being preyed on by an animal robber, it wouldn’t not the first. Lemurs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca58b178b>, exotic birds <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C48669cb8>, and other monkeys <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1b073a74> have been targeted by thieves in recent years.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6e3ef1d3>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRlQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bdf170dfd>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRmI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8ebcf03f>

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Pfizer vaccine Future Publishing/Getty Images
Stat: When you develop life-saving treatments during a global pandemic, you’re going to end up making a lot of money. Pfizer’s profits hit a record $100 billion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRmM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C744cb8cf> last year—57% of which was accounted for by its Covid vaccine and the antiviral pill Paxlovid. In fact, the combined sales of the vaccine and Paxlovid in 2022 topped Pfizer’s total revenue in 2019. But with Covid not the health emergency it once was, Pfizer warned that demand for both products will crash this year.

Quote: “Episode 3 of Last of Us is unbelievably good story telling. I am in awe of @Nick_Offerman performance. Incredible.”

Jeff Bezos became one of many viewers to heap praise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRmQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd4d1aa19> on the third episode of The Last of Us, HBO’s new video game adaptation that has become the talk of Sunday nights. Too bad Bezos’s own streaming service hasn’t produced anything of this caliber…

What else is brewing
Alec Baldwin <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2a5d1507> was officially charged with involuntary manslaughter over his fatal shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the set of Rust.

PayPal <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRmc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3a25faff> will lay off about 7% of its workforce in the coming weeks.

Whole Foods <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRmg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceae9df2e> reportedly asked its suppliers to help it bring down prices. As costs across the food supply chain have started to moderate, the grocery chain doesn’t want to be what your dad calls “Whole Wallet” anymore.

The UK’s economy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRmk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4acffbd7> is the only major economy that’s expected to shrink next year, per new IMF forecasts. Yes, it’s even expected to do worse than sanction-hit Russia.

DC Studios <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRmo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C98ad87e3> is renewing its attempt to rival the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Following a reboot under Warner Bros. Discovery, it announced its first 10 TV and movie titles.

Name that voice

Carl from Up was voiced by Ed Asner, who died in 2021. He serves as the inspiration for this quiz, which will give you an animated character and ask you name the actor who voiced them.

1. Mushu in Mulan

2. Meg in Family Guy

3. Mr. Fox in Fantastic Mr. Fox

4. Anastasia in Anastasia

5. Puss in Boots in Puss in Boots

6. Emperor Kuzco in The Emperor’s New Groove

  TOGETHER WITH

RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce13b5f64> 
Good morning. The slow, lumbering migration back to the office reached a major milestone last week, when 50.4% of employees <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3c743430> in the largest US cities commuted to work, according to Kastle Systems. It’s the first time since the pandemic hit that return-to-office rates exceeded 50% of pre-Covid levels.

Depending on your perspective, the takeaway could be that offices are half full…or remain half empty.

—Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Neal Freyman, Abby Rubenstein

Markets: Stocks closed lower <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C007b0eca> yesterday, with the Dow snapping a six day hot streak as investors started to get antsy about the size of the rate hike the Fed is likely to announce tomorrow. One stock managed to soar, though: Caravana, the flailing online used car marketplace. Despite still being way down from the highs it hit during the pandemic, it’s up 100% from where it started this year.

 

AUTO

EVs get cheaper as Ford joins Tesla in slashing prices <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D63cf7352> Pink ford riding a downward slope made of money <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E63cf7352> Illustration: Francis Scialabba, Photo: Ford
It looks like electric vehicle Black Friday has officially kicked off. Ford announced yesterday that it’ll cut prices on its electric Mustang Mach-E models by as much as 8%, putting the price range at about $46,000 to $64,000—which means it’ll be selling some of them at a loss.

The move follows the unprecedented and sweeping discounts that rival EV manufacturer Tesla rolled out earlier this month. Both companies hope that making the cars cheaper will convince more customers to buy them.

Why discount now?

Demand for pricey EVs is under threat as high interest rates make financing auto purchases more expensive and recession fears leave people less willing to crack open their piggy banks to snag dream cars. Ford and Tesla may also be considering the government tax credits, worth up to $7,500, for EVs priced under a certain threshold (some Tesla and Mach-E models will now be eligible). And there’s more competition <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C48e972e2> from automakers like Nissan and Chevrolet producing increasingly cheap EVs.But it’s not just EVs becoming more affordable:

New car prices have been slowing their ascent, and used cars were 9% cheaper last month compared to a year prior, when your 200k-miles-strong 2006 Corolla was a hot commodity amid supply chain issues and parts shortages.

Not everyone is celebrating

Many people who purchased a Tesla shortly before the price cuts are not thrilled about having to make hefty loan payments on what is now a less valuable depreciating asset. Some disgruntled Tesla buyers signed a petition demanding free or discounted software downloads for their vehicles, while others have inquired about refunds, according to the Wall Street Journal.

Big picture: Major automakers, which enjoyed soaring profits last year, are now bracing for a reversal of fortunes and looking at ways to cut costs. But difficulties notwithstanding, many companies are still ramping up EV production and legacy car manufacturers are pushing forward with electrification goals.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbab6b647>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B057d2708>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7dd52b22>    

TOGETHER WITH RAD DIVERSIFIED

Real estate investing built different <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb71352b> RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce278ca94>
Not all economic periods are created equal. But don’t sweat it—some investment opportunities are well-equipped to handle any economic period, good or bad.

RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cec24d409> is built to last through those ups and downs. They’re a nontraded public REIT (aka real estate investment trust) that invests in residential, commercial, and multifamily properties (not to mention income-producing farms) across the US.

Best of all? Their performance is *unaffected* by the stock market.

Need some receipts? RADD <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C896aedc7> made a 35.35% return in 2021. And RAD Diversified REIT stock value has increased by 122.2% since October 2019.

That’s how RADD is built different. Join the waitlist today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5f12a38f>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Protesters demanding justice for Tyre Nichols Scott Olson/Getty Images
Two more officers relieved of duty over the deadly beating of Tyre Nichols. The Memphis Police Department revealed yesterday that in addition to the five officers charged with murder over the fatal beating, Preston Hemphill and another officer whose name was not released were taken off duty <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4535fbe1> after the incident. Although Hemphill’s lawyer told the Associated Press he was not present during the violence that killed Nichols, the officer was present for the traffic stop that preceded it, and body cam footage appears to show him saying he had tased Nichols and “I hope they stomp his ass.” In addition, three employees of the Memphis Fire Department were fired yesterday for their involvement. Nichols’s funeral tomorrow will be held tomorrow.

Appeals court declines to dance the “Texas two-step.” That’s not a new TikTok craze: It’s a corporate maneuver whereby companies facing major liabilities spin off a new company to take them on, has the new company file for bankruptcy, and walks away unburdened—and yesterday, a federal appeals court refused to let Johnson & Johnson do it. J&J created a new unit to shoulder ~38,000 lawsuits claiming its talc-based products caused cancer, and the court’s ruling <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbbd5b988> dismissed that unit’s bankruptcy case. J&J, which maintains that its products are safe, said it would seek to have the ruling overturned.

Spring will bring flowers and an end to official Covid emergencies. President Biden plans to end both the public health and national emergencies originally declared to address the Covid pandemic <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQl8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cebbb3abf> in 2020 (and extended several times since) on May 11. The White House disclosed the plan yesterday while opposing efforts by Republican lawmakers to end the emergency declarations immediately with a bill called the Pandemic Is Over Act. The end of the emergencies will mean that many Americans will have to start paying for Covid tests, treatments, and vaccines. It also signals a shift in how serious the government considers the pandemic to be.

LAW

Are these NFTs ‘art’ or just a digital Canal Street? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D02f9c330> MetaBirkens <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E02f9c330> MetaBirkins
Luxury retailer Hermès and non-fungible token designer Mason Rothschild faced off in court yesterday in the first major test of how trademark law applies to NFTs and other digital designs.

Hermès claims Rothschild infringed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C38c0d6c6> on its trademark by digitally depicting furry versions of its iconic Birkin bag in his collection of 100 “MetaBirkin” NFTs. But Rothschild argues that MetaBirkins are a lawful, artistic interpretation of the brand’s product—similar to Andy Warhol’s prints of Campbell’s soup cans.

NFTs have been a moneymaker for luxury brands

Though the crypto downturn has deflated the value of NFTs from when Justin Bieber was bragging about his Bored Ape, Hermès says that Rothschild swooped its chance <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQkI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8336d846> to capitalize on digital collectibles at the height of the craze, like its peers did:

Dolce & Gabbana sold nine NFTs for about $6 million in September 2021.

Gucci bagged $25,000 on one short-film NFT two months prior.

MetaBirkens debuted at Art Basel in December 2021, and were sold and resold for tens of thousands of dollars. The platform they were originally listed on, OpenSea, pulled the collection at Hermès’s request, but copies continued to sell elsewhere.

Zoom out: The case’s outcome could set a precedent in this new area, but no matter who wins, the lawsuit itself could deter digital artists from featuring branded products in their designs.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQkM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C64f2db9f>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQkQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C41a4ebb0>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQkU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9893f59e>  

ENTERTAINMENT

The Oscars might take back a nomination <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dc96fccc2> Andrea Riseborough <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ec96fccc2> Roy Rochlin/Getty Images
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences will meet today to determine whether to rescind <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C39c1d860> Andrea Riseborough’s best actress nomination, and if it does happen, it would be the Academy’s most anti-indie-darling move of all time.

Riseborough’s nomination for her performance in To Leslie surprised Hollywood when it was announced, as the film had seemingly less heat than some Roku originals. To Leslie made less than $28,000 at the box office in a limited theatrical run. But in the waning days of the nominations voting period, endorsements poured in from stars like Jennifer Aniston, Kate Winslet, and Edward Norton. Cate Blanchett (also a nominee) even mentioned Riseborough in her Critics Choice Award acceptance speech.

What’s the issue? Well, there are many rules involved in Oscars voting, and in its campaign to receive votes, To Leslie may have violated a few. Potential issues are: a rule against contacting voters directly and encouraging promotion, and a rule against singling out competing nominees by name.

Zoom out: Most insiders predict that Riseborough’s nomination will be upheld, but some in the industry are upset that it takes away a place for lauded performances from Black actresses, like Danielle Deadwyler and Viola Davis, to be celebrated. Nominations have only been rescinded nine times in the history of the Oscars, and never for an acting nomination.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C217e86d5>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C90f2178c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQmI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2cebc030>

Key performance indicators Stacks of bills with 64% colored in Hannah Minn
Stat: As of the end of last year, 64% of US consumers were living paycheck to paycheck <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQkY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbdf5f9fe>, up from 61% the year before, according to a survey of ~4,000 people released yesterday by Pymnts.com and LendingClub. Even people earning more than $100,000 annually might be thinking twice about adding guac to their burritos as pay fails to keep up with inflation—more than half of them said they were part of the paycheck-to-paycheck club, per the survey.

Quote: “Boris, I don’t want to hurt you but, with a missile, it would only take a minute.”

Boris Johnson, the former British prime minister known for his floppy hair and partying during Covid lockdowns, told the BBC that Vladimir Putin threatened <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQkc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C774dc099> him by saying that or “something like that” on a phone call prior to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. Still, it’s not clear whether the threat, which did not appear in the publicly released record of the call, was sincere as Putin spoke in a “relaxed tone,” Johnson said. Russia claims no threat (joking or otherwise) was ever issued.

Chinese Zodiac signs

Earlier this month, Lunar New Year ushered in the Year of the Rabbit. The rabbit is one of 12 animal signs that make up the Chinese zodiac—can you name the other 11 animals?

For the competitive people: Give yourself 1 point for every correct animal, but take off .5 for a wrong answer.

 TOGETHER WITH

CardCritics <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzImbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdc48fef8> 
Good morning. Scratch that, great morning because the Eagles are going to the Super Bowl . After dispatching the 49ers, the Birds will square off against the Chiefs, who beat the Bengals in a thrilling game.

And for the cherry on top: Unlike the Phillies, the Eagles winning a championship has not been found to be correlated with a recession.

—Neal Freyman

Markets: The contrast <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb7363d6c> between news out of the tech industry and its performance in the market could not be starker. Investors are too busy drooling over the prospect of the Fed slowing down its rate hikes.

 

FINANCE

In just 3 decades, the ETF has taken over Wall Street <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D60f92599> A banner for the newly listed ProShares Bitcoin Strategy ETF hangs outside the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E60f92599> Spencer Platt/Getty Images
Thirty years ago yesterday, the first exchange-traded fund (ETF) in the US launched. In the decades since, these once-niche investment products have become ubiquitous on Wall Street, disrupting the mutual fund industry and transforming people’s relationship with the stock market.

You always remember your first

On Jan. 29, 1993, a dumb-looking spider decoration hanging in the American Stock Exchange heralded the arrival <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbe385e70> of the first US ETF—what’s now called the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust. It had a measly $6.5 million in assets and no one really paid much attention to it.

That’s changed. The first US ETF is now the world’s biggest, with $375 billion in assets, and the ETF sector in total had amassed $6.5 trillion in assets by the end of 2022. While mutual funds still have 3x the amount of assets that ETFs have, the tide is turning: Investors poured $600 billion into US ETFs on a net basis last year, but pulled out almost $1 trillion from mutual funds.

So, how does an ETF work and why have they become so popular? An ETF is simply a security that tracks the performance of a particular basket of investments, like stocks. The SPDR S&P 500 ETF, for example, tracks the performance of companies in the S&P 500. Many other ETFs also track indexes, allowing people to park their money in funds that follow the ebbs and flows of the broader market.

If that sounds like a mutual fund…it’s similar. But ETFs have a few advantages <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca0b5a3d0> over its stuffy, older cousin.

ETFs generally have lower fees than mutual funds.

They have built-in tax benefits.

They’re accessible to anyone with a brokerage account—you can buy or sell them like you would a stock.

Zoom out: All these advantages aside, the rise of ETFs has been also fueled by the growing recognition that trying to invest in individual stocks is foolish. Passive index funds, which aren’t designed for frequent trading, have surged to represent almost half <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbe4b1243> of US fund assets, compared to less than 2% in the early ’90s.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7cbe401b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf3cbf8c0>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4eb63390>   

TOGETHER WITH CARDCRITICS

WORLD

Tour de headlines Protesters block traffic as they rally against the fatal police assault of Tyre Nichols Seth Herald/AFP via Getty Images
Memphis PD disbands Scorpion unit. Citing “the heinous actions of a few,” the city’s police department disbanded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xeDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb627bd5e> the Scorpion unit after video of several of its officers brutally beating Tyre Nichols, who died three days later, was released Friday. Scorpion, which stands for Street Crimes Operation to Restore Peace in Our Neighborhoods, was intended to focus on certain high-crime areas of Memphis. Five former officers have been charged with murder in the death of Nichols.

Air Force general predicts US–China war. In a memo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xeDI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2d23647a> obtained by NBC News, Gen. Mike Minihan, head of Air Mobility Command, wrote that his “gut” tells him that the US will go to war against China in 2025. Why that date? Taiwan’s election in 2024, combined with the US’ own election that year, will create ripe conditions for Chinese President Xi Jinping to attack Taiwan. President Biden has said several times that the US military would respond if China invaded Taiwan.

M&M’s was just trolling us. Seems like everyone who suspected that M&M’s suspension of its candy mascots was just a PR stunt <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xeDM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3f473b67> was spot on. The brand told the NYT that its characters will be its “long-term spokescandies” and suggested they’ll reappear in an upcoming Super Bowl commercial. Last week, M&M’s said it was sending its mascots into retirement over right-wing backlash to their recent outfit changes.

MINING

Anyone see a tiny radioactive capsule lying around? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D08db26eb> Combing the desert in Spaceballs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E08db26eb> Spaceballs/Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
Authorities are frantically combing the desert in Western Australia to locate a tiny but highly radioactive capsule that was lost <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6675498c> in the vast, arid expanse.

The capsule seems to have fallen off a truck that was transporting it from a mine in the northern part of Western Australia to a suburb of Perth, the region’s largest city. And finding it won’t be simple: The route was 870 miles long and the capsule is smaller than a penny.

But what it lacks in size, the capsule makes up for in radiation. Containing the radioactive isotope cesium-137, the capsule emits the equivalent of 10 X-rays in an hour. Contact could cause burns, radiation sickness, and skin damage, and prolonged exposure could lead to cancer.

So, what’s it even used for? Mining companies deploy these capsules as sensors to calculate things like the thickness of pipes. The mining company that managed to lose this capsule, industry giant Rio Tinto, apologized and said it was launching an investigation into the perplexing circumstances of how this tiny object fell off a truck.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbf02b637>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0de80de1>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3646fe45>  

CALENDAR

The week ahead Fed Chair Jerome Powell Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Sources: Getty Images
A huge week for the economy: Following its first meeting of the year on Wednesday, the Fed is expected to raise interest rates by just 0.25%—a sign that its campaign to slow inflation is working. Also, the January employment report drops on Friday, which is projected to show sustained job growth despite all the layoff headlines.

Big Tech earnings: There’s an earnings report <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C39ef37ed> for everyone this week, whether you’re curious about hardware (Apple), retail (Amazon), or saturated fats (McDonald’s). Plus, Meta and Alphabet will give us crucial insight into the teetering digital ad market.

Close encounters of the green kind: A green comet will return <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C506f7b36> to our neighborhood for its first visit since Neanderthal times—and likely won’t come back for millions of years. It could be visible to the naked eye this week in the Northern Hemisphere, though binoculars will certainly help.

Everything else…

February, and Black History Month, begin on Wednesday.

Groundhog Day is on Thursday—and maybe on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday…who knows?

No football games on Sunday (well, there is the revamped Pro Bowl…but that doesn’t count).



TOGETHER WITH IMPACT.COM

Impact.com <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xcjQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzImbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7961bb7e>

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Key performance indicators
Stat: Mercedes just notched a major self-driving milestone—it became the first automaker to receive approval for “Level 3” autonomony <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C359d075b> in the US. That means in Nevada, the only state where its Drive Pilot system has been certified, you can legally play Tetris on the infotainment screen while the car “handles all aspects of the driving task” (at speeds up to 40mph). It’s a significant upgrade <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb16d026b> from Level 2 autonomy, which resembles a souped-up adaptive cruise control and requires you to keep your eyes on the road.

Quote: “A calculated attack on India, the independence, integrity and quality of Indian institutions, and the growth story and ambition of India.”

Indian industrial conglomerate Adani Group launched a stinging counterattack <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf5bf1327> on the short seller that accused it of accounting fraud and stock manipulation. In a 413-page rebuttal of those allegations, Adani claimed it did nothing wrong and argued that short seller Hindenburg was the company committing fraud. The conglomerate, which is led by billionaire Gautam Adani, suffered a $50+ billion market wipeout last week due to Hindenburg’s report.

Read: This is how social media platforms die. (Pluralistic <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C29fd5ba5>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
A suspected Israeli drone strike <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xeDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C664cb537> targeted a military compound in Iran. The attack comes amid heightened concern from Israel and the US over Iran’s nuclear development.

Novak Djokovic <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9803a2fb> cruised to his 10th Australian Open victory with a three-set win over Stefanos Tsitsipas. On the women’s side, Aryna Sabalenka won her first Grand Slam title.

House Speaker Kevin McCarthy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd1A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdb271a9f> will meet with President Biden on Wednesday to discuss resolving the debt ceiling problem.

Public health officials <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C80602a36> are raising concerns over a new strain of gonorrhea that evades drugs.

Only Connect

Today’s trivia is inspired by Only Connect <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C26c9b501>, a scintillating but wicked UK game show. I’ll give you four items and you have to find the link that connects them all.

For example, if I wrote: Orange, October, Velvet, and Glorious, you’d correctly answer that they were all revolutions.

Got it? Here we go…

1. Pretzels, double-entry bookkeeping, kung fu, genetics

2. Baltimore & Potomac station, The Temple of Music, Ford’s Theatre, Dealey Plaza

3. Socrates, Snow White, Emma Bovary, Erwin Rommel

4. Bowl, cistern, brook, beagle

ANSWER

1. Things developed by monks.

2. They are all places where US presidents were shot.

3. People who died (or entered a very deep sleep) from poisoning.

4. These words end in names of birds.

  TOGETHER WITH

Mugsy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C40c40de6> 
Good morning. Can ChatGPT write a funny comic? Max wanted to know. So he asked the chatbot to provide a topic for his Saturday Sketch, and then faithfully drew up the response.

We’ll let you judge the quality of the joke yourself, but at least from our POV…Max shouldn’t lose sleep over AI taking his job. For now.

—Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: It was a happy Friday <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0944e20c> indeed for the stock market. All three major indexes closed the week in positive territory—and for the Nasdaq, that meant a fourth straight week of gains. After their worst year ever in 2022, Tesla shares have begun 2023 with a Liam Neeson-level vengeance, soaring nearly 65% this month and 31% this week alone.

 

BUSINESS

Goldman Sachs CEO joins the ranks of execs taking pay cuts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5828cc6e> CEO looking at smudged hundred dollar bills <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5828cc6e> Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Sources: Getty Images
Goldman Sachs tightened its belt at the expense of its CEO’s wallet. The investment bank announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce327bb26> yesterday that CEO David Solomon received a 29% pay cut in 2022. But it’s unlikely that he’ll be staging a walkout, as his new compensation still came in at a not-too-shabby $25 million.

Solomon’s shrinking paycheck reflects the financial struggles that have been plaguing the bank under his leadership:

Goldman Sachs has lost $3 billion since 2020 on its troubled foray into commercial banking, and its profits declined last year amid a slowing economy.

The bank let 3,200 employees go this month, its biggest layoffs since the 2008 financial crisis, according to the New York Times.

But Solomon is not the only CEO to see his pay package get smaller. Rival bank Morgan Stanley, as well as Apple and Alphabet, have all recently cut CEO compensation (in most cases alongside layoffs).

Why are executive pay cuts so hot right now?

Slashing executives’ pay is a cost-cutting measure that doubles as a way to signal that bosses are weathering economic headwinds alongside rank-and-file workers.

A 2021 study from Oxford University showed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32e0cb70> that companies that prioritize paying employees over managers in difficult times tend to get a better rep with customers. It can also be a way to placate disgruntled shareholders who are not too pleased to sponsor the caviar-filled lifestyles of company leaders as they watch their investments dip into red territory.

Zoom out: CEOs still aren’t exactly hurting. The heads of the biggest US companies made 399 times more than the average worker in 2021, according to the Economic Policy Institute, an almost 20-fold increase in the pay ratio since 1965.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C35907efc>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bc2865d05>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C787aae66>    

TOGETHER WITH MUGSY

Your thighs have a new best friend… <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8af94d68> Mugsy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca77dd23c>
Yep, those thighs right there , wrapped handsomely in a pair of Mugsy jeans <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf22201dd>—the most comfortable jeans ever made.

If they could talk, they’d be telling you how Mugsy jeans are the softest, comfiest jeans a set of thighs has ever called home.

And if they could shout, these thighs would be screamin’ about the incredible stretch Mugsy jeans deliver, keeping the fit juuust right—never too baggy and never too tight <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb8b9fd90>.

But thighs can’t talk, so you’ll have to trust the 13,000+ 5-star reviews on Mugsy’s site, like this one: “Just. Buy. Them. Absolute perfection.”

WORLD

Tour de headlines
Intel raises alarms for the chip industry. Due to a lack of demand for chips and a slowdown in its data processing center business, the company reported its worst financial results <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C36e96c26> since the dot-com bubble popped at the turn of the century. Though the stock only ended up falling 6.4% by the time the market closed yesterday, Wall Street definitely took notice of the company’s troubles: Twenty-one analysts slashed what they thought it was worth, and many did not hold back in describing the chipmaker’s fall. “No words can portray or explain the historic collapse of Intel,” one said.

Asia’s richest person may not be for long. Billionaire Gautam Adani’s conglomerate has lost $51 billion in value in a sell-off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7c224213> sparked by a report from US-based short-selling firm Hindenburg Research accusing the Adani Group of “pulling the largest con in corporate history.” Though Adani has denied the report and threatened legal action, the market has responded strongly, with some of his companies falling by 20% yesterday. The timing is particularly bad for Adani, as yesterday marked the beginning of a planned $2.45 billion share sale.

CANNABIS

FDA doesn’t know WTF to do with CBD <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da630a7ec> Bottles of CBD oil <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea630a7ec> Leon Neal/Getty Images
The Food and Drug Administration said on Thursday it can’t vouch for the safety of cannabidiol <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3621215c> (CBD)—a nonpsychoactive compound found in marijuana and hemp plants—and because of that, it can’t regulate it. Instead, it’s calling on lawmakers to help supervise $12 CBD lavender sodas.

Why? The FDA said that CBD doesn’t fit the mold of the dietary supplements and food additives it typically monitors, such as ginseng and caffeine. The agency claims the science is lacking on the safety of long-term CBD use, let alone on any potential perks—like preventing diabetes or aiding sleep.

This game of legal Hacky Sack is a major drag for CBD advocates

Congress legalized hemp four years ago, and most CBD is derived from hemp, not marijuana. As a result, CBD got kicked off the controlled substances list and got lobbed from the Drug Enforcement Administration’s desk to the FDA’s.

Since then, the FDA’s been less active in regulating CBD than a teen in a ’90s anti-marijuana ad. That’s resulted in a chaotic and confusing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdl8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C784f2c52> marketplace, and CBD industry players were hoping the FDA would soon start reining it in.

Looking ahead…while CBD advocates expressed frustration at getting sent back to square one, some members of Congress are optimistic that they can finally sort the issue out.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce581cd62>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc2cd017e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbac61b29>  

TRANSPORTATION

Your bike can sleep with the fishes (in a good way) <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D3b0c5b37> Underwater bike garage in Amsterdam. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3b0c5b37> travelism/Getty Images
Oh, to be an Amsterdammer—free from finessing a U-lock onto a frozen street sign. A new $65 million bike parking garage <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb1510da4> opened Wednesday in the largest city in the Netherlands, and it is all underwater.

Going under…the facility is at Amsterdam’s Centraal Station, which sees roughly 200,000 travelers arrive per day—about half by bike. To access the new parking facility, you can bike right up to the moving walkways that take you and your wheels into the depths of what used to be just canal water. The structure took four years to build and can hold 7,000 bikes. Its capacity will increase to 11,000 when a second structure opens in February. (Here’s a pretty sick time lapse <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C37d934f0> of how they drained all that water and built the garage.)

While it cost a lot to build, the parking is cheaper than most bus fares in the US: Parking is free for the first 24 hours and roughly $1.46 per day after that.

Big picture: This new facility is a logical investment for a country in which bicycles outnumber the residents. Dutch people are the most physically active on the planet primarily because biking is such a huge part of their daily lives, according to a 2021 study from global research firm Ipsos.—MM

Do you wanna know a sec(REIT)? Real estate investment trusts (REITs) like RADD <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdXY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf396bd03> own portfolios that can generate income, equity, or both. Their stock is up 122.22% since October 2019 (as of Oct. 26, 2022) while amassing over $100m in properties and offering 13% in distributions back to investors in 2022. Find out how RADD REIT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdXY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7d4f59a8> can build your wealth into a legacy.



GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A coin going into a piggy bank Itaú Unibanco via Giphy
Stat: Whether we’ve got a recession coming remains the biggest will they or won’t they story since Aang and Katara, but it looks like more Americans are starting to sock away cash just in case. Data released by the Department of Commerce yesterday puts the savings rate <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C61de83ca> for December at 3.4%—the highest level in seven months and the biggest uptick from the previous month since July 2021 (November’s rate was 2.9%). Could be that everyone’s just saving up in case Taylor Swift adds more tour dates…

Quote: “Up until now, I was a professional tidier, so I did my best to keep my home tidy at all times. I have kind of given up on that in a good way for me.”

Renowned declutterer Marie Kondo has admitted that, like every other parent who is constantly stepping on Legos strewn across the living room floor, she’s let her house become less organized <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd2E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee8272eb> since giving birth to her third child. This sparks joy for the rest of us slobs.

Read: The economics of all those influencer trips to Dubai. (Wall Street Journal <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd2I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6a9a5e02>)

 TOGETHER WITH

Facet Wealth <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xcGY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2c3bf410> 
Good morning. TIL there is such a thing as “burrito season.” Chipotle said yesterday it’s hiring 15,000 employees to prep for “burrito season”—the period from March–May that represents its busiest sales stretch on the calendar.

So if we’re getting this right…

March–May: burrito season

June–August: ribs season

September: soup season

October: spooky season

November: Soup Season 2: The Return of the Soup

December–February: cuffing season

—Neal Freyman, Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Matty Merritt

Markets:  The positive vibes coming out of Tesla’s earnings helped propel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf7ad9a8a> the stock market higher yesterday—as did Q4 GDP numbers, which we’ll get to in a bit. All three major indexes are on track to close out the week, and the month of January, in the green. (Side note: How is January almost over?)

 

ECONOMY

How’s the economy doing? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5efcc8d3> Larry David saying <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5efcc8d3> Curb Your Enthusiasm/HBO via Giphy
Larry David’s favorite tagline also happens to be an apt description of the economy right now: It’s pretty, pretty good.

US gross domestic product (GDP), the broadest measure of economic activity, grew at a 2.9% annualized pace <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C91286dd9> in Q4 2022, which topped expectations. And it’s rock-solid proof that the recession we’ve been warned about for months ain’t here yet.

Not only has the US economy regained <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C840b50c3> all the lost output from the Covid recession, but it’s also returned to its growth trajectory from before the pandemic. Real GDP per capita, which factors in inflation, has reached its highest level ever.

Is this a sign of a “soft landing”? Q4’s strong GDP numbers add fuel to the argument that the Fed could actually pull off the tricky “soft landing”—where it knocks down inflation through interest rate hikes without sending economic growth into reverse. The resilient labor market is cooperating: Despite all the headlines about layoffs, jobless claims fell last week to their lowest point since April 2022.

But don’t write off a recession just yet

Economists combing through the GDP report found a few warning signs that indicate a recession remains a clear and present danger. Here are a few:

Consumers are pulling back. Personal consumption, which represents about 70% of all US output, came in below forecasts, signaling Americans aren’t reaching for their wallets like they had been earlier in the pandemic. Growth in business inventories also suggest a more cautious consumer.

The housing market got pummeled. The sector shrank at a 27% annualized pace last quarter as higher mortgage rates put home-buying and construction on ice.

Companies are slowing down their spending. In Q3, business investment grew 6.2%; in Q4, just 0.7%.

Bottom line: The US economy is in a fluid state right now, being tugged in different directions by large, complex forces. Even the people who study it 50 hours a week only speak in probabilities (e.g., “there’s an X% chance Y will happen”). When execs and economists say the outlook is “uncertain”—they mean it.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C88cca600>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfe1b42d3>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5631d579>
