Markets: Remember the stock rally to start 2023? Yeah, us neither. The Dow and S&P fell for the third straight day <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5caf6443> over concerns that—what else?—the Fed will keep hiking interest rates. Fed Vice Chair Lael Brainard didn’t calm any nerves by saying that central bankers “are determined to stay the course” until inflation is back at their 2% target.

 

FILM

Alec Baldwin will be charged in fatal ‘Rust’ shooting <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dcb3fc1b8> Alec Baldwin <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ecb3fc1b8> Mega/Getty Images
Prosecutors announced yesterday that actor Alec Baldwin and Rust armorer Hannah Gutierrez-Reed will be charged with involuntary manslaughter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5f2b503b> for the on-set shooting that killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and injured director Joel Souza in 2021.

The charge, filed in New Mexico, is a fourth-degree felony, which means that Baldwin and Gutierrez-Reed could face up to 18 months behind bars and a $5,000 fine. But prosecutors also tacked on a provision that could result in five years of prison time because a gun was involved.

Baldwin’s attorney responded, “This decision distorts Halyna Hutchins’ tragic death and represents a terrible miscarriage of justice…we will fight these charges, and we will win.” Baldwin also sued crew members including Gutierrez-Reed and Rust assistant director David Halls in November, alleging they were negligent in handing him the gun.

How we got here

During a rehearsal for the movie Rust in October 2021, Baldwin’s gun—which was pointed at Hutchins—fired live ammunition and killed her. Baldwin has repeatedly denied pulling the trigger, saying that he had started to cock the gun and released the hammer. Gun experts have been hesitant to support Baldwin’s claim, arguing that would be essentially impossible.

So, how did this happen? Investigators for the Santa Fe Sheriff’s Department haven’t released information on how live ammunition ended up on a film set, but a separate investigation by the state’s Occupational Health and Safety Bureau found that firearm procedures on the set were lax. The agency fined Rust’s production company the maximum amount ($137,000) for not following proper safety precautions.

The report also uncovered <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C33b69e37> emails and texts that producers sent to Gutierrez-Reed urging her to spend less time on her gun-handling and training tasks to make time for her other props duties.

Two firearm misfires five days before the fatal shooting went ignored by Rust management, per the report.

Big picture: The tragedy on the Rust set renewed long-standing safety concerns in the film industry over fatal prop gun mishaps on sets, as well as the minimal training required to become a firearms specialist for film and TV.—MM

TOGETHER WITH THE ASCENT

WORLD

Tour de headlines Reed Hastings Picture Alliance/Getty Images
Reed Hastings pulls a Bezos and a Gates. After more than 20 years at the helm of Netflix, Hastings is giving up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C22012a8d> his co-CEO role and becoming executive chairman, the company announced yesterday. An OG, Hastings co-founded Netflix in 1997 and grew the Blockbuster-destroying DVD rental company into an entertainment giant that disrupted Hollywood. How’s that going now, you ask? In its earnings report released yesterday, Netflix revealed it smashed subscriber targets <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C62aecb7b> in Q4.

SCOTUS leaker remains a mystery. Eight months into its investigation, the Supreme Court said it still can’t find <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3af81c46> the culprit behind the leak of its draft opinion that overturned Roe v. Wade last summer. That bombshell leak was unprecedented—never in the court’s history had an opinion been made public before it issued its ruling—and rattled confidence in the institution. Investigators are still following a few loose strands, but they don’t sound particularly confident their efforts will turn up anything.

France rocked by protests. More than 1 million French people protested <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1eb97a1b> President Emmanuel Macron’s controversial plan to raise the country’s minimum retirement age from 62 to 64 yesterday. Many workers also went on strike, resulting in the closing of schools and the cancellation of transit routes and flights. But the battle over the retirement age is just getting started, as major French unions announced a second day of strikes on January 31. Macron says lifting the retirement age is necessary to keep the country’s pension fund from drying up.

ECONOMY

Extraordinary times call for extraordinary measures <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dfeaba563> Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen testifies before the House Finance Committee in the Rayburn House Office Building November 4, 2015. She is wearing a purple blazer and in the act of removing her glasses from her face. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Efeaba563> Chip Somodevilla via Getty Images
As the US crashed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cec8917d1> into the $31.4 trillion debt ceiling yesterday, the Treasury Department began taking what it called “extraordinary measures” to prevent the government from defaulting on its debts and sparking an economic crisis.

What does that actually mean? These measures are a series of deep-cut accounting moves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C24f23c7f> that allow the Treasury to continue making its payments. They include:

Suspending reinvestments into government funds for retired federal employees, such as the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund.

Selling existing investments in those funds to free up more outstanding debt.

And while these measures definitely aren’t ordinary…they probably aren’t so “extra,” either. The Treasury has resorted to them more than 12 times since 1985, including during the last debt-ceiling standoff in 2021.

Still, these steps amount to chugging water after eating a ghost pepper—the pain will return. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said her extraordinary measures will last through early June, giving lawmakers about five months to work out a deal to raise the debt ceiling.

Big picture: The US has never defaulted on its debt, but even the threat of it could be disastrous. The country’s first credit downgrade in history came during a debt-ceiling showdown in 2011.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C93e304bc>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xNy0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce6f8825a>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C007f0b93>  

RETAIL

Amazon isn’t smiling anymore <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xODA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D153e8d8f> Amazon boxes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xODA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E153e8d8f> Kevin Hagen/Getty Images
With the sheepish energy of someone requesting a refund from the Girl Scouts because their Thin Mints box is dented, Amazon on Wednesday announced that it will shutter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xODE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfc26854b> its charitable donation program, AmazonSmile, by Feb. 20.

AmazonSmile was launched in 2013 and donated 0.5% of eligible purchases to a charity of a customer’s choice. As of the end of December, the program had doled out about $449 million to a wide variety of charities over its existence. Still, Amazon claims AmazonSmile hasn’t been as impactful as it originally hoped. The sheer number of charities in the program (1+ million globally) spread its donations too thin, the company wrote in an email to customers.

The move is yet another entry in a string of measures the tech giant has taken in recent weeks to cut costs after a pandemic hiring spree doubled its global workforce to over 1.6 million.

Those other cost cuts: Amazon announced this month that it would lay off more than 18,000 workers in what likely is the largest workforce reduction in the company’s history. Amazon has also called it quits on riskier business ventures like its telehealth service and a video chat projector for kids.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xODI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7bda9eb2>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xODM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdf97e456>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xODQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d77721f>

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A basketball rim attached to the Eiffel Tower Francis Scialabba
Stat: The Chicago Bulls played <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xOGw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8156c5f0> an NBA game in Paris yesterday for the first time since Michael Jordan came to town in 1997. Since then, the league has seen an explosion in international players. In 1997, there were 29 international players on opening day rosters; this season there are 120 from 41 countries, accounting for about one-third of all players. And they’re among the best in the NBA—two international players (Serbia’s Nikola Jokić and Greece’s Giannis Antetokounmpo) won the last four MVP awards.

Quote: “Everything is on the table.”

Could FTX be resurrected? Maybe <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xODU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cba7a6a7e>, according to its new CEO. John J. Ray III, in his first interview since taking over the company, told the WSJ that he created a task force to explore the possibility of reviving the bankrupt crypto exchange, and if they find that it makes sense, “we’ll do it.” FTX’s maligned token FTT, which was at the center of its epic blow-up, spiked more than 30% after Ray’s comments were published.

Read: Fake meat was supposed to save the world. It became just another fad. (Businessweek <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xODY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2012c70f>)

What else is brewing
David Crosby <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xODg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9b68a88b>, of Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young and other bands, died at 81.

Instagram <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xODk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceefc2f64> is debuting a Quiet Mode that lets you pause notifications.

LIV Golf <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xOGE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd7305b71>, the Saudi-backed PGA Tour competitor, inked its first broadcast rights deal with CW Network.

WWE Executive Chairman Vince McMahon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xOGI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce5386ec5> reached a settlement with an ex-wrestling referee who accused him of rape in 1986, per the WSJ.

US mortgage rates <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xOGM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C25288a98> fell to their lowest level since September.

ANSWER

13112221. This is a pretty diabolical set of integers known as the “Look-and-say sequence <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xOGs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C192debf5>.” To get the next number in the sequence, you read off the digits of the previous item.

For instance, “1” is “one one” so the next item is “11.” From that comes “two ones,” so you write down “21” and so on. So, to get the next term in the sequence above, it would be “one three, one one, two twos, two ones.”

 TOGETHER WITH

Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fVz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjkwOTE1LjMwNjk3NzMmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb0485cec> 
Good morning. The countdown to economic catastrophe has officially begun . The US will hit its debt ceiling today, though Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said she’ll implement “extraordinary measures” that will keep the government from defaulting on its debt until probably early June.

Still, June isn’t that far away, and Congress needs to work out a deal pronto to raise the government’s borrowing cap and avert almost assured economic turmoil and market chaos.

What were we saying again? Oh yeah, good morning.

—Max Knoblauch, Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: Stocks tanked <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cce7db26e> yesterday, with the Dow plunging, the S&P having its worst day since mid-December, and the Nasdaq coming down from a seven- day rally. As investors started heeding recession signals again after new data revealed weak retail sales during the holiday season last month, companies that sell consumer staples were hit especially hard.

 

ENTREPRENEURSHIP

The pandemic’s entrepreneurial boom isn’t over yet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2De36b5957> Mark Cuban on Shark Tank <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ee36b5957> Shark Tank/ABC Network via Giphy
At the rate Americans are creating new businesses, Shark Tank is going to need to increase its episode count by about 4,000 to keep up with demand. More than 5 million new business applications were filed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7844788f> in 2022, according to new data from the US Census Bureau.

About 14,000 new business applications were filed in the US every day last year—although it’s still too soon to know how many of those aspiring Scrub Daddies will actually make it off the ground.

Whether this represents a testament to the country’s entrepreneurial spirit, an indictment of 9-to-5s, or simply a case of everyone seeing the same TikTok about the tax benefits of forming an LLC, it’s a sign that the pandemic-era startup boom may be here to stay.

And it was quite a boom

Despite the vast number of Steve Jobs biopics that were being created, the US was actually experiencing a 40-year decline in entrepreneurship before the pandemic, per the NYT. But then things changed: The number of new businesses created in 2020 increased by 24% from 2019 to 4.3 million as laid-off workers found their savings accounts boosted by stimulus payments and a bull market. Also helpful: rock-bottom interest rates.

The trend continued in 2021, ballooning to 5.4 million applications.

And now we know that the swell continued into 2022. But some areas saw more growth than others. The Southern US has had a 53% increase in new businesses since 2019, with the most growth coming from Florida and Texas, per Bloomberg analysis. New England, on the other hand, is falling below the national average.

Looking ahead…we’ll have to wait and see if these businesses thrive and the trend continues in 2023. A looming potential recession, high inflation, and personal savings dropping to near 60-year lows (per the Bureau of Economic Analysis) all signal turbulence ahead for new companies, which already have a roughly 50% failure rate during good economic times.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8ccbd911>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C921dcbf0>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C78f59fb6>   

TOGETHER WITH MASTERWORKS

Which platform delivered millions to investors in 2022? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fVz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjkwOTE1LjMwNjk3NzMmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1ee1b33d> Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fVz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjkwOTE1LjMwNjk3NzMmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C27686b58>
In the same year everyday investors lost a whopping $350b, Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fVz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjkwOTE1LjMwNjk3NzMmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce5c26007> had its best year ever. Their 9 art sales returned $25.8 million to investors—a record amount. Talk about a happy new year…

So, what did investors do with their cash? Charter a yacht in Ibiza? Finally close on that Alpaca farm? Maybe save a little? Naaaah.

Either way, Masterworks wants to do the same thing for you. This fintech unicorn <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fVz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjkwOTE1LjMwNjk3NzMmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C87333b59> is unlocking an asset class that was once available only to billionaires.

To kick off the new year, Masterworks is inviting Morning Brew readers to open a free, no-obligation account today. Isn’t it time you check them out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fVz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjkwOTE1LjMwNjk3NzMmbHA9dGV4dDM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc2c5326e>?



WORLD

Tour de headlines The Microsoft logo David Becker/Getty Images
Tech layoffs continue. Microsoft announced plans to cut <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM28_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb1f86f14> 10,000 employees yesterday, and Amazon began a round of layoffs that will impact 18,000 people. These are just the latest tech company layoffs, many of which have begun thinning their ranks after rapidly expanding during the pandemic now that they’re facing rising interest rates, smaller digital ad budgets, and less consumer spending. According to the tracker Layoffs.fyi, the sector shed more than 154,000 jobs in 2022 and has already cut around ~37,500 this year.

Ukraine helicopter crash kills 14. Ukraine’s Interior Minister Denys Monastyrskyi, who oversaw police and security forces, was among those who died when a helicopter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C307e31ee> crashed into a kindergarten in a Kyiv suburb yesterday. Monastyrskyi is the highest ranking Ukrainian official to die since Russia invaded the country. Ukraine said it had not yet determined if the crash, which occurred amidst a dense fog, was caused by an attack or an accident.

The Avengers are going back to China. Disney said it will release <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cef394372> two Marvel films in China in February, ending what amounted to a three-year ban on the franchise by the country’s censors that likely cost the studio hundreds of millions of dollars. Black Panther: Wakanda Forever and Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania will be the first Marvel movies to open in China, the world’s second-largest movie market, since 2019—a sign that China may be easing up on restrictions for new Hollywood films.

FASHION

Shein’s valuation about as sturdy as its clothes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D794e8a78> Shein shopping bag. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E794e8a78> Yuichi Yamazaki/Getty Images
Not even the powerhouse of dresses with weird cutouts has been spared by investors’ newfound skepticism toward exorbitant tech company valuations. Shein, the fast-fashion retailer that bills itself as a tech firm, is looking to raise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca1b574c9> $3 billion more from its existing investors at a $64 billion valuation—a sharp drop from the $100 billion valuation the company had in April, according to the Financial Times.

Fast rise: Shein grew rapidly in the last few years, and was considered a no-brainer investment for backers flush with cash.

Fast fall: Now, after spending years throwing billions at any tech company whose slide deck had the word “disruptor” in it, VCs are getting stingy as interest rates rise and the global economy slows down. So, Shein (along with a lot of other companies) is stuck entering a “down round”—i.e., being forced to raise funds at a much lower valuation, the FT reported, though the company told the FT it “denied the accuracy” of some of the report.

But all those tissue-thin tees are still big business. Despite a collage of controversies <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C36579901>, Shein brought in $15.7 billion in revenue in 2021, per Reuters, and is said to have only grown last year.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf9168d71>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C832c5d35>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbb8bcb75>  

TECH

Twitter HQ has a garage sale <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D91ba477a> A Twitter labeled gavel hits a Bid button <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E91ba477a> Morning Brew
A giant bird statue, blue soundproof booth, pizza oven…apparently all of these things no longer spark joy for Twitter CEO Elon Musk.

The social media company kicked off 2023 by listing 631 items from its San Francisco headquarters in a virtual auction <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cabcdc134> that concluded yesterday afternoon. Some fun facts:

A single bird statue sold for $100,000.

Over 20,000 people registered to bid, making this the most popular auction that Heritage Global—which also ran an Enron auction—has ever organized.

Twitter is pinching pennies millions

Musk said in December that Twitter was on track to lose $3 billion net annually when he acquired it in October, and Platformer recently reported <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8c0ae535> that the company’s daily revenue is down 40%. To counteract that, Musk’s version of saving ketchup packets in the fridge has included extreme measures, like laying off over 50% of workers and not paying rent <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4bd10114>, as well as smaller moves, like this auction and deciding there really is no such thing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3dfd0b38> as a free (corporate) lunch.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf39e8198>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf9164876>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2d1eb07>    

TOGETHER WITH LETSGETCHECKED

LetsGetChecked <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fLT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjkwOTE1LjMwNjk3NzMmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7f6737f4>
Testing, testing. Working on your health resolutions? Stat: A new study <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd69ed5aa> shows that eating even just one freshwater fish caught in the US puts the same amount of toxic “forever chemicals” into your system as drinking PFAS-contaminated water for a month. So, maybe order the chicken next time if you’re looking to get more lean protein into your diet.

People must enjoy being mocked by a cute kitty while they deploy their Sicilian Defense because ever since Chess.com introduced the bot at the beginning of January, the site has averaged 27.5 million games per day—putting it on track for 40% more games to be played on the site this month than any other in its history (including back when everyone was watching The Queen’s Gambit).

 TOGETHER WITH

Fundrise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9aeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDgmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C98088e71> 
Good morning. If you’re having trouble keeping up with all of your group chats, one dad’s message to his family provides an off-the-shelf template for anyone to use (via @snakel3t <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9aej9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C007dd7b0>):

“I can’t keep up with the pressure of always having to lol or like or heart everyone’s random thoughts, pics and amusements.

For all future texts: I love them, laugh at them, or like them, unless it’s bad, then I dislike them.

In perpetuity.

I can’t live with this pressure. I’m out.”

—Matty Merritt, Sam Klebanov, Max Knoblauch, Neal Freyman, Holly Van Leuven

Markets: The Dow snapped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fZj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C332ceb35> its four-day winning streak after Goldman Sachs posted its biggest earnings whiff in more than 10 years (Q4 was miserable for dealmaking). Crypto prices, though, continued to tick higher, and bitcoin has now clawed back all of its losses since the implosion of FTX.

 

SOCIAL MEDIA

TikTok is dropping out of college <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D39689528> Longhorn over phone with x over it. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E39689528> Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Alano Design/Getty Images
The University of Texas at Austin, one of the largest public universities in the nation, banned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9faD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb8084d01> TikTok from its wi-fi and across its wired networks yesterday—and not because someone made a call-out video of Bevo’s Shein haul.

The university is complying with Texas Gov. Greg Abbott’s recent decision to forbid state employees from having the app on government-issued devices. And it’s just the latest major US campus to confine its students to Instagram Reels: Public universities in at least five states, including Auburn University in Alabama, the University of Montana, and schools in the University System of Georgia, have banned the app.

The backstory: In the last few months, more than half of US states have barred TikTok from government devices, according to CNN. Government officials all the way up to President Biden—who last month signed legislation that included a TikTok ban for federal devices—are on edge about the national security and privacy concerns around the app, which is owned by China’s ByteDance. In the past year, ByteDance has admitted to tracking journalists who cover it, and accessing US TikTok user data from China.

These college bans will mostly be...annoying

When you tell a college student not to do something, they’re probably going to find a way to do it. Tech-savvy undergrads are skirting the bans by using their own data or personal wi-fi to access one of their favorite social media platforms.

Still, the bans are causing uncertainty, and everyone from communications professors to the people running university mascot accounts are wondering how these restrictions will affect their work. Think of the college improv teams trying to Impractical Jokers people, or the sorority rush chairs who use the app to hype recruitment.

But it goes beyond depleting DG’s follower count: Some critics also argue that banning TikTok on university wi-fi hinders <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9faT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C957bbe04> professors’ abilities to better understand the app and how it spreads the misinformation politicians are so concerned about.

Bottom line: It’s unlikely that most students at UT-Austin, Auburn, or any other school that decides to ban TikTok in the future will ditch the app. According to Pew, 67% of 13- to 17-year-olds have used the platform, making it the second most popular app behind YouTube.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9faj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C69302e12>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9faz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8bda63c1>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf2023133>   

TOGETHER WITH FUNDRISE

Invest smarter, not harder <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9aeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDgmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8f71e2df> Fundrise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9aeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDgmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8a8a8adc>
There are a lotta ways to diversify your portfolio, but not many that are built specifically to protect your investments as much as they are to capture growth. There is one alternative investment manager to put on your radar that stands above the rest.

We know what you’re thinking: In this economy?

That’s right: We’re talking about Fundrise. With a decade-long track record of outperformance through various market environments, they can help you invest smarter by adding real estate private equity to your portfolio. Even better, Fundrise expects 2023 to be one of the most opportune real estate investing environments of the last decade.

Find out how Fundrise’s real estate portfolio <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9aeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDgmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0a4444b3> is well positioned for the long haul and join over 350k other investors here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9aeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDgmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccf3bff01>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Police officers carry Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg out of a crowd of protesters. Hesham Elsherif/Getty Images
Greta Thunberg hauled away by police at German coal mine protest. The climate activist and other demonstrators were detained <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb724970f> (and later released) by police yesterday while protesting the demolition of a village to allow for the expansion of a coal mine. Protesters had been trying to defend the town, called Lützerath, for years, turning it into a symbol of government hypocrisy on climate change. But the energy crisis spurred by the war in Ukraine and Germany’s desperate search for more energy sources, lent new urgency to the coal mine’s expansion. Last week, hundreds of protesters who had been living in Lützerath were cleared out by police.

Disney’s proxy battle is getting nasty. The Mouse House is not pleased that activist investor Nelson Peltz is trying to gain a spot on its board. Yesterday, the company bashed Peltz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbdf6490b> for lacking a “basic understanding” of the media industry (Peltz has a history of pushing for changes at consumer giants like P&G and Unilever). Last week, Peltz launched a proxy battle with the Disney board after accumulating a $900 million stake. He claims that Disney’s acquisition spree has harmed shareholders, and he’s called out the company’s fumbled execution of its CEO succession plan.

🪓 Microsoft prepares the pink slips. The tech giant is following its peers and will reportedly lay off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caf2bec91> a large number of employees today: a rumored 5% of its workforce, equivalent to more than 10,000 people. CEO Satya Nadella recently said that Microsoft wasn’t “immune to the global changes,” and predicted a “challenging” next two years. Still, Microsoft isn’t totally hunkering down. It’s also prepping its largest startup investment ever: $10 billion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fUz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd395f46c> into ChatGPT creator OpenAI.

WORLD

A shrinking China isn’t good for anyone <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Df2db37db> Chart showing China's population <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ef2db37db> Morning Brew
China recorded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fcD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C904b0b0d> a population drop in 2022—its first in over six decades, government data shared on Tuesday showed. The last time this happened was in 1959–1961, when the abysmal Great Leap Forward economic initiative caused widespread famines.

Though it occurred sooner than demographers predicted, the current decline isn’t shocking—China's birthrate has been dropping for years, reaching a record low in modern history in 2022. Observers blame the high cost of parenthood, strict COVID lockdowns, and decades of the restrictive one-child rule. As a result of the country’s aging population, funerals outnumbered baby showers by about 850,000 last year.

Everyone–not just China–should be worried

An aging population usually creates a noxious economic cocktail of less working-age people available to fill jobs and more retirees requiring costly care. This can slow economic growth (any gains in the daytime television industry notwithstanding), which for various reasons <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fcT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1f0970ad> in China was already at a multi-decade low of just 3% last year.

If things go south for the world’s second-largest economy, the rest of the world would feel it, too. Fewer workers in the exporting powerhouse of China could mean more expensive products for consumers globally, as well as reduced demand for goods and services that the country sources from abroad.

Zoom out: Some experts are staying optimistic about China’s future, pointing to its ongoing embrace of less labor-intensive industries like semiconductors and finance, while manufacturing shifts to countries with more abundant workers.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fcj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5da1a6a7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fcz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C018ca949>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fdD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb9da1f52>  

FOOD

Tinned fish is the hottest new extremely old trend <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fdT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D38344975> Canned tuna <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fdT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E38344975> Francis Scialabba
Whoever heads up PR for the anchovy lobby deserves a few extra zeroes at the end of their paycheck. After reportedly being killed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fdj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7dffad69> by millennials just four years ago, canned fish—like tuna and sardines—are surging <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fdz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C78a286ad> in popularity, receiving a huge boost over the last year from TikTok and sustainability trends.

Sales of canned seafood shot up by 10% (to $2.7 billion) in the US in 2022, according to Euromonitor International. The primary driver? TikToks in which aesthetic, photogenic tinned fish boards are prepared as part of a romantic date night charcuterie.

While some users claim the trend is “giving Great Depression,” it doesn’t seem to be slowing down. Over the course of last year, users on the app posted their #tinnedfish dinners—some claiming to do this every week—and the hashtag now has more than 26 million views.

Companies are jumping aboard the cannedwagon, utilizing vintage design styles in packaging and developing new strategies, like selling pairing kits, to move fish. Scout Canning, a popular Vancouver-based brand, told the WSJ that its revenues jumped 82% in 2022.

Could be nice for Earth, too: Tinned fish’s long shelf life, lack of refrigeration requirements, and recyclable packaging make for a more climate-friendly protein than many other meats.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9feD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C844c32ee>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9feT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C407696f2>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fej9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce4c0bc29>

Quote: “This song sucks.”

At least one person isn’t impressed by the imitative powers of ChatGPT. For the gram

We’re handing over the mic to our copyeditor, Holly, who’s going to give you all a grammar quiz. Can you spot the stylistic/grammatical errors in the following Brew sentences?

(No literary sensibilities were harmed in the making of this puzzle. We caught each error before the fish emoji hit Slack.)

A survey from Resume Builder found that 90% of companies will require a return to the office this year, signaling a shift away from the softly-enforced hybrid policies that became popular during the pandemic.

The world’s richest person and CEO of luxury goods conglomerate LVMH named his daughter Delphine Arnault CEO of the fashion house Dior, setting up a sibling battle for succession of his company.

With a narrow majority in the House, these early days are key for the GOP in organizing and setting the stage for their agenda leading up to the 2024 general election.

NATO crisis diffused. NATO member Poland said that the missile strike that killed two people there on Tuesday was likely launched unintentionally by Ukraine as it tried to defend itself from Russian shelling.

Click to Share <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zSD9hY2Nlc3NfdG9rZW49OW1IN04yTW1FS2ZmTDYxejRrZFFmdmI1Jm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZiZjaWQ9MzAyNzk2MzUuMzA2NjIwOA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Fc1eeb6b3> Or copy & paste your referral link to others:morningbrew.com/daily/r/?kid=f2654ef3 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zST9raWQ9ZjI2NTRlZjMmbWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI3OTYzNS4zMDY2MjA4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C702db65a>

ANSWER

A writing tip you can keep in your pocket (if it’s not already there) is that adverbs ending in -ly should not be hyphenated. Here “softly-enforced” should become “softly enforced.”

If Bernard Arnault had more than one daughter, this sentence would be correct. But he only has one, so “Delphine Arnault” should be offset by commas.

Here is a classic case of a misplaced modifier, as it sounds like the early days won a narrow majority in the House. The fix we went with: “With a narrow majority in the House, the GOP needs to optimize…”

The problem here is homonyms. We meant “defused,” which means to make less tense. “Diffused” means spreading out.

✤ A Note From The Motley Fool

Markets: Markets were closed for MLK Day in the US yesterday, but they were hopping across the pond in Britain and Europe. Stocks closed higher in both France and Germany. And in the UK, the blue-chip FTSE 100 index nearly matched <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C827ad93d> a record high it clinched in 2018 as investors continue to get hope from signals that global inflation is beginning to ease.

 

WORK

Employers are trying to take back the power on RTO <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XaD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dc043b5f0> A large open floor plan office from a scene in Orson Welles's The Trial. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XaD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ec043b5f0> The Trial/Studio Canal
The ongoing tug of war between remote employees (who are feeling more productive and less burnt out) and their employers (who are feeling bad about paying for an office) could experience a balance shift in 2023. Major companies, aware of fears about a potential recession, are issuing directives <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XaT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C85e847b2> to come into the office for more days, sometimes under the threat of termination.

Last week, Disney CEO Bob Iger told hybrid staff that, starting on March 1, they must return to the office four days a week. Two days later, Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz announced a similar three-day RTO requirement, expressing irritation at internal badge swipe data that revealed employees were not “meeting their minimum promise” regarding hybrid work.

Employees at Vanguard, Paycom, and News Corp have also received recent orders to phase out remote work in the new year. A survey from Resume Builder found that 90% of companies will require a return to the office this year, signaling a shift away from the softly enforced hybrid policies that became popular during the pandemic.

A controversial resolution

That doesn’t mean employees are excited to add commute time or “getting asked about weekend plans” back into their lives: According to a recent Gallup poll, 34% of remote-capable workers want to work from home permanently and just 3% want to work in the office full time. A Monster survey in September found that 40% of workers would quit if they had to come into the office even one day a week.

But there’s an issue with that: Remote work is getting hard to find. Between February and October 2022, remote job listings fell from 20% to 14% of all listings on LinkedIn. Now, even more employers seem empowered to demand <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XTT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C22719f95> in-office time.

Remote hope is not lost: On the flip side, Twitter CEO and vocal remote work critic Elon Musk recently ordered Seattle employees to WFH as a cost-cutting measure.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xaj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C82cd18cf>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xaz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce4aaf8ea>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XbD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc88bab99>   

TOGETHER WITH LIQUIDPISTON

The little, lighter engine that could <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9NUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5NiZscD10aXRsZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca5bd72ed> LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9NUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5NiZscD1pbWFnZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03974cd8>
It’s called the X-Engine™. And even though it’s smaller than other engines, Little X delivers up to 10x the power-to-weight ratio <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9NUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5NiZscD10ZXh0MQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce79b3206> of legacy engines and 30% more fuel efficiency.

But that’s just the start. When the EV market grows 380% by 2030, there will be a shortage of precious metals like lithium. That’s where X-Engine comes in, enabling hybrid electric cars to use 80% smaller batteries. 

It’s no wonder X-Engine’s creators at LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9NUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5NiZscD10ZXh0Mg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3cfe612e> have already secured $30m in contracts to do everything from shrinking generators to flying military drones 2x farther.

Become a LiquidPiston shareholder as they take the tiny-but-mighty X-Engine full throttle.

Don’t just say “I think I can.” Invest in LiquidPiston’s X-Engine today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9NUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5NiZscD10ZXh0Mw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0a53b578>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Mob boss Matteo Messina Denaro after he was arrested In Sicily Carabinieri via Getty Images
Mafia boss nabbed. Italy’s most wanted man, Matteo Messina Denaro, a Mafia boss who had been on the lam for more than 30 years, was arrested <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XbT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C12ef6a80> in Sicily yesterday. Messina Denaro, who once bragged that you could “fill a cemetery” with his victims, is allegedly the head of the Cosa Nostra syndicate. Despite dodging authorities since 1993, he has been convicted in absentia and given life sentences for his role in various crimes, including the murder of two anti-Mafia prosecutors; bombings in Florence, Milan, and Rome that killed 10; and the slaying of the young son of a Mafioso who turned state’s witness.

Ukrainian soccer club pledges $25 million for soldiers. Rinat Akhmetov, Ukraine’s richest man and the owner of the Shakhtar Donetsk football club, announced the donation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xbj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cce602086> yesterday after agreeing to trade star player Mykhaylo Mudryk to Chelsea FC in a ~$110 million deal. The cash will go to soldiers and their families to cover a variety of needs, including medical treatment and psychological support. Akhmetov said he is confident Ukraine will win the war against Russia and “we will play a friendly against Chelsea at Donbass Arena in a Ukrainian Donetsk.”

Elon Musk heads to court over Tesla tweet. Elon Musk regularly gets into spats over his tweets—he seems to enjoy it so much that he bought the platform, but he’s probably less enthused about the legal trial <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xbz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0f3a3102> starting today over one particular tweet from 2018. In it, Musk (who never met a 4/20 reference he didn’t like) said he had secured funding to take Tesla private for $420 per share, and investors are suing Musk and Tesla since the deal never happened. So far, Musk is expected to testify this week, and his odds don’t look great: The judge already determined that the tweet was false and reckless, but now a jury will weigh whether Musk knew it was false and whether it was material to investors.

TECH

Artists sue AI art generators <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XcD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da1c3e8eb> A corgi eats an avocado in space <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XcD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea1c3e8eb> Midjourney
Art made by AI has won prizes, been displayed in museums, and taken over Twitter profile pics, but not everyone’s happy with how it turns users into elven princesses.

Three artists are suing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XcT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd1904dd4> Midjourney, Stability AI, and DeviantArt for their use of an AI art-generating tool called Stable Diffusion. The artists—Sarah Andersen, Kelly McKernan, and Karla Ortiz—allege the tool violates millions of artists’ copyrights.

How AI art generators work: Stable Diffusion has been fed billions of images scraped from the web in order to train its AI on how to do things like identify an “avocado.” So when a user types “corgi eats an avocado in space” into an AI art generator that uses Stable Diffusion, it creates new works <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xcj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca06ef6f9> based on the images it’s analyzed.

But whether it’s derivative or plagiarism is up for debate

The suit claims that Stable Diffusion cobbles together pieces of copyrighted images, but creators of AI art-generating tools argue that their use of existing pictures to train the AI to make new ones is covered by “fair use” doctrine—which allows using copyrighted materials for “transformative” purposes.

Bottom line: This case could set an important precedent on training AI tools that could go way beyond the art world.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xcz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf9b7ab8b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XdD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C151ff2a3>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XdT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfe6f7f55>  

SCIENCE

Lasers to lightning: ‘Follow me’ <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xdj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Df8ce3514> Lightning in the night sky <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xdj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ef8ce3514> Getty Images/assalve
Watch out, Zeus: Scientists haven’t completely mastered lightning, but they’ve successfully used a laser to divert its direction. A study <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xdz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce57548a5> published yesterday described an experiment in which a laser was shot at a storm cloud from atop a Swiss mountain to successfully direct lightning toward the ground.

This marks the first time the method worked outside a lab, and that’s a big step forward for public safety.

Lightning causes billions of dollars in damage and claims over 4,000 lives a year.

It would be much worse had Benjamin Franklin not invented the lightning rod, which to this day remains the go-to for protection from lightning. But the man would have turned 317 today, so it’s about time his invention was updated—especially since the Franklin rod is a godsend for your home, but it’s insufficient for bigger places like airports or wind farms.

So, how did we one-up a founding father?

Scientists unleashed a rapid-fire barrage of laser pulses at thunderclouds, creating a path of charged particles that lightning was more likely to follow. Four lightning bolts were steered toward a rod mounted on top of a telecom tower that is a frequent target of lightning strikes.

Looking forward: It’ll be a while before you’ll be able to catch regular laser-lightning shows in the night sky due to an eye-popping price tag: The system used in the experiment costs $2.17 billion.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XeD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C76d12d30>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C323a745e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xej9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9c76f63f>

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Scrooge McDuck Scrooge McDuck/Disney via Giphy
Stat: The world has created $42 trillion in new wealth since 2020—but you probably didn’t see a big chunk of that hit your bank account, because 63% of it is in the hands of the richest 1% of the population, per a report <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XQT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49b54575> released by Oxfam yesterday. Advocating for steeper taxes on the wealthiest as the world’s most influential people arrived in Davos to ski and try to solve all the world’s problems, the charity noted that for every $1 of that new wealth earned by a person in the bottom 90%, a billionaire managed to snag another by $1.7 million.

Quote: “We love to quote King in and around the holiday…but then we refuse to live King 365 days of the year.”

Speaking at a commemorative service at Ebenezer Baptist Church, where Martin Luther King Jr. preached, the civil rights leader’s youngest daughter, Bernice King, delivered a reminder <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XQj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0686fd76> yesterday that we’ve still got a long way to go as a society to realize her father’s dream. Acknowledging that his challenging words are sometimes flattened into platitudes in today’s political discourse, she sought real action instead, saying, “Dr. King, the inconvenient King, puts some demands on us to change our ways.”

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING

The White House Counsel’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XRD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6dda2241> office said there are no visitor logs for President Biden’s Delaware home (as is typical for presidents’ private homes), in response to a demand from Republican lawmakers to see logs after classified documents were found there.

Ryan Cohen <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XRT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd5d1b5cb>, an investor known as the meme-stock king, has built up a stake in Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba and is pushing it for more stock buybacks, according the WSJ.

China’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XTj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3d03c478> population declined in 2022 for the first time since the early 1960s, and India is poised to overtake it as the world’s most populous country soon.

The Belfer family <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XRj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2012b595>, a New York oil dynasty known for its philanthropy that previously invested in Enron and Bernie Madoff, now ranks among FTX’s shareholders, too.

Taliban officials <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XRz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2999868f> are buying blue checks on Twitter.

Parental guidance

We’ll give you two brands, and you have to determine whether they’re owned by the same parent company or not. If you answer “yes,” give yourself a bonus if you can name the corporate overlord.

Marvel Entertainment and The Simpsons franchise

Gucci and Fendi

Chrysler and Maserati

Snapple and Canada Dry

Pittsburgh Penguins and Liverpool FC

ANSWER

Yes: Disney

No: Gucci is owned by Kering and Fendi is owned by LVMH.

Yes: Stellantis (the result of a merger between Fiat Chrysler and PSA Group)

Yes: Keurig Dr Pepper

Yes: Fenway Sports Group

Yogi Tea <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9TYT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzAmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5b0028cb> 
Good morning. Today is Martin Luther King Jr. Day. Not only is it a federal holiday to honor the legacy of Dr. King, but it’s also the only federal holiday to be designated as a National Day of Service. So let this be a nudge to roll up your sleeves and get active in your local community—you can make a positive difference.

—Neal Freyman
